column1: Add Printing Specifications Support in Packaging Graphics (UST)
column28:
'+*Description:*+

We need to support Printing Specifications in the UST Packaging Graphics.
• In the Packaging Graphics Master section, display the following details in the header bar:

*Packaging Graphics Master title - Master ID - Region - comments*

{color:#de350b}*Packaging Graphics Master - 5439031 - Germany (DE) - Digipack*{color}

• Below this header, add a “Printing Specifications” button.
• When a user clicks this button, a popup should appear. The popup should replicate the layout and fields from the existing legacy Packaging Printing Specifications configuration.
• In the popup:
        A bar should display *Printing Specification - Master ID - Region - Comments*
        The form area should contain the same sections and fields as the legacy version
        Auto-population: Product Type should be automatically filled based on the Product Configuration.
        All other fields and behavior should remain consistent with the legacy Packaging Printing Specifications.

+*Mockup:*+

!image - 2025-10-03T164157.549.png|width=835,height=182!

*Pop up - PKGF Printing Specifications*

!Printing Specifications Pop-up.png|width=548,height=389!
+*User Story:*+

*As a* user,

*I want* to access and edit printing specifications directly from the Packaging Graphics Master section in UST

*so that* I can manage printing details for different product types

+*Acceptance Criteria*+

1. Header info shows in PKGF graphics section

*Given* the user has navigated to the UST - Graphics - Packaging Graphics section and opened a Packaging Graphics Master,
*When* the master details load,
*Then* the header displays *Packaging Graphics Master - Master ID - Region - comments.*

2. “Printing Specifications” button

*Given* the user is viewing a Packaging Graphics Master in the Packaging Graphics section,
*When* the user clicks “Printing Specifications” button,
*Then* a popup opens.

3. Popup content

*Given* the Printing Specifications popup is open,
*When* it renders,
*Then* the popup has a bar shows *Printing Specification - Master ID - Region - Comments*

4. Legacy parity of form

*Given* the Printing Specifications popup is open,
*When* the page loads,
*Then* the layout and fields match the legacy Packaging Printing Specifications one-for-one

5. Product Type auto-population

*Given* the master has a Product Configuration,
*When* the popup loads,
*Then* Product Type is auto-populated from the Product Configuration

*Given* the Package Printing Specification popup window is open,
*When* the Product Type field is pre-populated from the product configuration,
*Then* the Product Type dropdown should still remain editable, allowing users to open the dropdown and customize or change the value if needed.

6. Product Configuration missing

*Given* the master has no Product Configuration
*When* the popup loads,
*Then* the Product Type field remains blank (no auto-population)

7. For "Close" button

*Given* the Package Printing Specification popup window is open,
*When* the user clicks either the “Close” button or the “X” icon in the top-right corner,
*Then* the popup window should close.

*Given* the Package Printing Specification popup window is open,
*When* the user clicks anywhere outside of the popup or on other parts of the page,
*Then* the popup window should remain open and not close.

*Given* the user has made changes inside the Package Printing Specification popup but has not clicked “Save”,
*When* the user attempts to close the popup by clicking the “Close” button or the “X” icon,
*Then* the system should display a confirmation message such as:
“You have unsaved changes. If you close now, all unsaved information will be lost.”

column1: Display Track-Level "Footage Type" for Video Products on Product Details Page
column28:
'+*Description:*+


To enhance metadata visibility for all video products, we need to display Track-Level "Footage Type" information on the Product Details Page.


Whenever the product is a video product, an additional column named "Footage Type" should appear in the Track-Level section. This column should show the corresponding footage type value for each track under that product.

!Footage Type.png|width=529,height=151!

+*User Story:*+
*As a* user, 
*I want* to view the "Footage Type" for each track of video products on the Product Details Page, 
*so that* I can view the footage type of each track directly

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
*1. Given* the user is viewing a video product on the Product Details Page,
*When* the Track-Level section is displayed,
*Then* a column named "Footage Type" should be visible for each track.
*2. Given* a video product with multiple tracks,
*When* the Product Details Page loads,
*Then* each track row should correctly display its associated Footage Type value retrieved from the backend.
*3. Given* a track has no assigned "Footage Type" value,
*When* the Track-Level table is displayed,
*Then* the corresponding "Footage Type" field should show a blank or "N/A" value.

column1: Migrate Product Metadata Viewer Features to Product Details Page
column28:
'+*Description*+

We want to consolidate the current Product Metadata Viewer functionality into the Product Details Page.
• The Product Metadata Viewer page should be simplified to only contain a Search Box for entering a Product Number and a “Load Product” button. Once the user clicks Load Product, they should be redirected to the Product Details Page showing all product details.

!Product Metadata Viewer UI.png|width=556,height=192!
• On the Product Metadata Viewer’s legacy page, there is a Country Release Date section that does not currently exist on the Product Details Page. We need to add this information on the Product Details Page:
1. Display it next to Release Date.
2. Add an Info Icon next to Release Date.
3. When a user clicks the Info Icon, a popup should appear showing a table of all country-specific release dates (e.g. Country Name, Release Date).

• The legacy page also contains a Bonus Material section, primarily for assets such as Digital Booklet Standard. We need to migrate this functionality into the Product Details Page:
1. Place this section below the Product Version Indicator section.
2. This section should be expandable/collapsible.
3. If the product contains Bonus Material, the section should be visible and expandable.
4. If the product does not contain any Bonus Material, the section should remain hidden.

• We need to include the “Footage Type” field. This field is currently displayed on the legacy Product Metadata Viewer page and should now be migrated and displayed on the Product Details Page to ensure continuity of metadata visibility for users.

Once these changes are complete, the legacy Product Metadata Viewer interface will be deprecated and reduced to the search + load flow only.

!Product Details Page 2.0.png|width=624,height=394!

Country Release Date

!image-2025-09-30-17-23-14-609.png|width=546,height=271!

!Footage Type.png|width=567,height=162!

+*User Story*+

*As a* user,
*I want* to search for a product number and load its details on a unified Product Details Page,
*so that* I can view all product metadata (including Country Release Dates and Bonus Material) in one place without using multiple tools.

+*Acceptance Criteria*+

Scenario 1: Load Product from Metadata Viewer
*Given* a user enters a valid Product Number into the Product Metadata Viewer search box,
*When* the user clicks the Load Product button,
*Then* they should be redirected to the Product Details Page showing that product’s full details.

Scenario 2: Display Country Release Dates
*Given* a product has country-specific release dates in the backend,
*When* the user views the Product Details Page,
*Then* an Info Icon should appear next to the Release Date.
        *And* when the user clicks the Info Icon,
        *Then* a popup should display all Country Release Dates in a table format (Country Name, Release Date...)

Scenario 3: Country Release Dates absent
*Given* a product does not have country-specific release dates,
*When* the user views the Product Details Page,
*Then* no Info Icon should appear next to Release Date.

Scenario 4: Display Bonus Material Section
*Given* a product contains Bonus Material (e.g. Digital Booklet Standard),
*When* the user views the Product Details Page,
*Then* a Bonus Material expandable section should appear under the Product Version Indicator section.
        *And* when expanded,
        *Then* it should display the relevant Bonus Material assets.

Scenario 5: Bonus Material absent
*Given* a product does not contain Bonus Material,
*When* the user views the Product Details Page,
*Then* the Bonus Material section should remain hidden and not expandable.

Scenario 6: Metadata Viewer Simplification
*Given* a user accesses the Product Metadata Viewer,
*When* the changes are deployed,
*Then* the page should only display the Search Box and Load Product button, with all other metadata functionality migrated to the Product Details Page.

Scenario 7: Footage Type

*Given* the Product Details Page is loaded for a selected product,
*When* the product metadata is retrieved,
*Then* the field “Footage Type” should be displayed on the Product Details Page.
**

*Given* that the “Footage Type” value exists for a product in the legacy Product Metadata Viewer,
*When* the data migration is complete,
*Then* the same “Footage Type” value should appear on the Product Details Page.
**

*Given* that a product does not have a “Footage Type” value,
*When* the Product Details Page is loaded,
*Then* the “Footage Type” field should still be displayed with a blank or “N/A” value.

 

 

*Questions*
1. The legacy Product Metadata Viewer page has both a Product Search Box and a Master Search Box.
Do we need to make any changes to the Master Search Box as part of this work?
(remain as is, be migrated , or be removed entirely?) – no need to consider Master search

2. When accessing the Product Metadata Viewer via Product Number search, the page currently displays additional information such as Organization, Data Source, Barcode, Genre, P Line, and C Line.
Do we need to migrate these fields to the Product Details Page? – They're already there

column1: [BE]UST - Stereo Audio - AQC - Email Notification - Phase1 (Email Notification Post Reg.)
column28:
*Questions:*
Should the AQC email notification be an event based notification or by defult any uploader should get the notification ? - Should be event based & can use the QC notes event - Create 1 new event for notification Name -  AQC Reg. report
Attached notepad should it have track master id or master id ? 
If a product has 10 tracks and AQC done for 4 tracks we send out the email notification but after the user has registered the remaining 6 tracks should the 2nd email notification have all the 10 tracks or only 6 tracks ? - It should be consolidated all the time

*Notes for user story:*

When a user registers an asset and when the AQC is completed for that registered asset the user should get an email notification,
On that email notification there should be a notepad attachment with the AQC info in it, the attached notepad should have the following information "Last Updated Date", "Master Id"
"Master type", "Artist", "Master Name", "Registered By", "Sequence number", "Track Name", "ISRC", "P-Line", "Actual Duration", "Entered Duration" & "AQC Notes"
On the body of the email notification we should have the following information:
Master details as on the registration email and below that there should be a table with the Asset ID, Track Master ID, Side #, Track #, Asset Name, Track Title, AQC Status, AQC Note.
If a product has 10 tracks and if the user registered only 4 assets and if the AQC was completed only for 4 assets then the email notification should be sent out and the 
attached notepad should have the details for the 4 tracks and the later when the user registers the remaining 6 tracks another email notification should be sent out which should include all the 10 tracks.
If the user goes ahead and swaps an asset for which the AQC is completed then the email notification should be sent out and the attachment should have all the 10 tracks and for the asset which had been swapped should have the text (Swapped) the email notification table should also have the same 10 tracks with the (Swapped) text next to it.

The registration email & the AQC email should be 2 separate email.

*Email Subject:*
AOMA Registration : 000005701890 - [G010001399810B] - Esa-Pekka Salon - Bruckner: Symph - Audio Master WAV 16 Bit - Status: Successful
AOMA AQC : [Product Number] - Artist Name - Product Title - Audio Master WAV 16 Bit - Status: Successful
AOMA AQC : [Product Number] - AQC Status -  Artist Name - Product Title - Nelsons proposal.

AQC Successful : [Product Number] -  Artist Name - Product Title - Mike's proposal.

No Valid Issue Found - AQC Successful(Nothing To Report) : [Product Number]_[Master Id]_Artist Name_Product Title - TO BE REVIEWED

Issue Found - AQC Successful(Bug Reported) : [Product Number]_[Master Id]_Artist Name_Product Title - TO BE REVIEWED

*If no AQC reported - come up with a proposal and review it with Mike* - 

*Master ID on the subject line* -
 # AQC *Successful(Think about identified, Bug Reported, etc...)* : [Product Number] - {Master ID] -  Artist Name - Product Title - Master Type - proposal
 # AQC Successful : [Product Number] - {Master ID] -  Artist Name - Product Title - Master Type
 # - *Should be same as duration mismatch email - Check & compare this - Status should be more on the AQC reported itself and not the job status*

 

Registration Successful : [Product Number] -  Artist Name - Product Title - Mike's proposal.
QC Notes Locked : 000027226689 - [G0100055965639] - Alex G - Far and Wide - Status : Pending - Current video 
QC Notes Locked - Pending Approval : [G0100055965639] - Alex G - Far and Wide - Mike's Proposal
QC Notes Locked : 000027225589 - TBDBD - TBD18 - Status: Pending - Current Master Only
QC Notes Locked - Pending Approval : 000027225589 - TBDBD - TBD18 - Mike's Proposal  Master Only 

 

*User Story 1:* Email Notification on AQC Completion for Registered Assets
As a user, I want to receive an email notification when the AQC is completed for my registered assets so that I am informed of the status of my registrations.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user has registered assets
*WHEN* the AQC is completed for any of the registered assets
*THEN* the user receives an email notification with a notepad attachment containing AQC information.

 

*User Story 2:* Notepad Attachment with AQC Information
As a user, I want the email notification to include a notepad attachment that contains AQC information related to the completed asset so that I have a record of the relevant details.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* an email notification is sent due to AQC completion
*WHEN* the notification is sent
*THEN* the notepad attachment includes “Last Updated Date”, “Master Id”, “Master type”, “Artist”, “Master Name”, “Registered By”, “Sequence number”, “Track Name”, “ISRC”, “P-Line”, “Actual Duration”, “Entered Duration”, and “AQC Notes” for the completed asset(s).

 

*User Story 3:* Comprehensive Email Body with Asset Details
As a user, I want the body of the email notification to include detailed information about all registered assets in a structured format so that I can see the asset overview easily.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* an email notification is sent due to AQC completion
*WHEN* a user opens the email
*THEN* the body includes a table with Asset ID, Track Master ID, Side #, Track #, Asset Name, Track Title, AQC Status, AQC Note for all registered assets.

 

*User Story 4:* Email Notification for Newly Registered Assets
As a user, I want to receive an email confirmation when I register additional assets after AQC completion for previously registered assets so that I am updated about my assets.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user has registered 4 assets and the AQC is completed for those
*WHEN* the user registers 6 additional assets
*THEN* the user receives an email notification including details for all 10 registered assets.

 

*User Story 5:* Notification for Swapped Assets
As a user, I want to be notified when I swap an asset for which the AQC has been completed, including comprehensive information about all assets and indications of swapped assets.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user swaps an asset that has already undergone AQC
*WHEN* the swap is recorded
*THEN* the user receives an email notification detailing all 10 tracks with the swapped asset marked as (Swapped) in the notepad and the email body table.

+*Email attachment template:(Check with Rithwik on the new fields - This should be added to the attachment)*+

|1234560|1234560| | | | | |What the problem is |*The date & time on when the last reg. happened (Including Asset Swap)*|

Reviewed the entire story with Mike on 7/10/2025 over a separate teams call and have updated the story with his inputs:

*Questions for Mike:(7/17/2025)*

Should we be including the invalid efficay on the email notification

Do we need both attachment + AQC Notes column  on the email table

 

Email Subject:
AOMA Registration : 000005701890 - [G010001399810B] - Esa-Pekka Salon - Bruckner: Symph - Audio Master WAV 16 Bit - Status: Successful
AOMA AQC : [Product Number] - Artist Name - Product Title - Audio Master WAV 16 Bit - Status: Successful
AOMA AQC : [Product Number] - AQC Status -  Artist Name - Product Title - Nelsons proposal.
AQC Successful : [Product Number] -  Artist Name - Product Title - Mike's proposal.
Registration Successful : [Product Number] -  Artist Name - Product Title - Mike's proposal.
QC Notes Locked : 000027226689 - [G0100055965639] - Alex G - Far and Wide - Status : Pending - Current video 
QC Notes Locked - Pending Approval : [G0100055965639] - Alex G - Far and Wide - Mike's Proposal
QC Notes Locked : 000027225589 - TBDBD - TBD18 - Status: Pending - Current Master Only
QC Notes Locked - Pending Approval : 000027225589 - TBDBD - TBD18 - Mike's Proposal  Master Only 

 

*Event Name:*

AQC Completion Report 

 

+*Scenarios for Subject Lines:*+

*Event: Post Registration AQC* 

1) AQC completed successfully for all uploaded assets

   a) No AQC reported at all - *AQC successful (No Issue Reported): Maser ID - [Product Number] - ArtistName- ProductTitle - MasterType*

   b) At least one AQC reported - *AQC successful (Issues Reported):* {*}Maser ID - [Product Number] - ArtistName- ProductTitle - MasterType{*}{*}{{*}}

2) AQC partially failed to complete successfully for at least one asset due to any backend error

   a) No AQC reported at all - *AQC Partially Failed (No Issue Reported):* {*}Maser ID - [Product Number] - ArtistName- ProductTitle - MasterType{*}{*}{{*}}

   b) At least one AQC reported - *AQC Partially Failed* *(Issues Reported):* {*}Maser ID - [Product Number] - ArtistName- ProductTitle - MasterType{*}{*}{{*}}{*}{{*}}

3) AQC failed completely for all uploaded assets due to any backend error

column1: [UI]UST - DBKS - Error Button
column28:
*User Story*

As a user registering a DBKS asset,
I want the system to automatically display a red error button on the master if any backend validation fails,
So that I can quickly see what went wrong and how to fix it without needing to refresh the browser.

*Acceptance Criteria*
*Scenario 1: Backend validation fails*
*Given* the user has submitted a DBKS asset registration request,
*When* one or more secondary (backend) validation checks fail,
*Then* the system should automatically display a red error button on the top-right corner of the master screen,
*And* this should happen in real time without requiring the user to refresh the browser.

*Scenario 2:* Error button click opens error details
*Given* a red error button is displayed on the top-right corner of the master screen,
*When* the user clicks on the red error button,
*Then* a pop-up window should appear,
*And* the pop-up should display all validation errors in red text,
*And* the corresponding solutions or recommendations should be displayed in blue text,
*And* the format and style should be consistent with how errors and solutions are shown on the "cover".

*Scenario 3: No backend validation errors*
*Given* the user has submitted a DBKS asset registration request,
*When* all secondary (backend) validation checks pass,
*Then* no red error button should appear on the master screen.

*Scenario 4: Real-time update*
*Given* the user has submitted a DBKS asset registration request,
*When* the backend validation completes,
*Then* the system should automatically update the UI (master screen) with the error button if applicable,
*And* this should occur without requiring a manual browser refresh or navigation.

column1: UST - Stereo & Immersive - Registration Support - Immersive & Stereo to the same product/UPC with related ISRC Support
column28:
User Story : Display Relevant ISRC for Immersive Assets
As a user of UST, I want the interface to display the correct ISRC specifically for immersive assets, so that I can differentiate between immersive and stereo content.

Acceptance Criteria:
GIVEN I am viewing a product with both stereo and immersive assets in UST,
WHEN I select the immersive bucket,
THEN the interface should display the related ISRC instead of the stereo ISRC.

===================================================================

+*TEST CASES FOR QA:*+

*Test Case 1* - Displaying - Open a product check on PD page for the ISRC what all immersive isrc is avialable only those buckets should be displayed
                 i.  Show immersive isrc on immersive master(related isrc) & show stereo isrc on stereo master.
                 ii. Duration - for immersive master the immersive track duration should be displayed & similar for stereo

*Test Case 2* - Registration - Open a product check on PD page for the ISRC what all immersive isrc is avialable only those buckets should be displayed.
                 i. If a product has 10 tracks and only 3 has 360 RA track only those 3 tracks should have select file button.
                 ii. If a product has 10 tracks and only 3 has dolby atmos isrc then those 3 tracks should be registered - As per Rohit for this use case FULL MASTER SIDE should not be displayed.

*Test Case 3* - QC Notes - Create master hieracy on the QC notes;
                 i. Show immersive isrc on immersive master(related isrc) & show stereo isrc on stereo master.
                 ii. when the QC button is clicked from the respective master only the tracks which has an ISRC for that respective master should be displayed. Eg. if only 3 360RA isrc is present in a product of 10 tracks on the QC notes section for 360RA only 3 tracks should be displayed.

*Test Case 4* - Bulk Linking - Linking & Unlinking.
                i. Registering Immersive & linking it to stereo
                i. Registering Stereo & linking it to Immersive                

 

+*Products used by BA & Dev's for testing on stage:*+

STAGE:
G010000244847Q - Stereo Only 
G0100030839754 - Stereo Only Empty master

G0100048573833 - Dolby Only

360Only 

G010004927823F - 360RA product has Dolby - Check with Rohit on the ISRC part 

G010003198417C - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA - Issue UST displaying only stereo 
G010004925584G - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA
G010004878684V - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA
G010004134682B - Stereo product - Has all immersive

G010004878684V - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA empty master

G0100041093413 - 360RA which has virtual immersive + virtual stereo

column1: UST - Stereo & Immersive -  Registration Support - Immersive & Stereo to the same product/UPC
column28:
*Prerequisite:*

 

*User Story 1:* Direct Registration of Immersive Assets
As a user of AOMA, I want to directly register immersive audio assets to the same UPC or ISRC as its stereo assets, so that I can manage both master types of content under the same product.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I have loaded a stereo or immersive product on UST,
*WHEN* I want to register or swap an asset on a track,
*THEN* I should be able to register immersive audio assets (Atmos, 360RA, 7.1, 5.1, Quad) to the same UPC or ISRC as stereo.

*User Story 2:* Display of Immersive Buckets in Stereo product
As a user of UST, I want to see immersive buckets in the same interface as stereo product when related ISRC or UPC exists, so that I can easily access immersive content associated with a stereo product.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I am viewing a product in UST,
*WHEN* the product has related immersive ISRC(s),
*THEN* the immersive buckets should be displayed alongside stereo buckets.
 * 
 -- 
 --- 
 ---- Can be removed - User Story 4:* Backfill of Immersive Assets
As a product manager, I want to backfill existing standalone immersive assets into the single UPC product so that all related content is consolidated.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I have existing standalone immersive products,
*WHEN* the backfill process is executed,
*THEN* the assets should be successfully moved to their corresponding single UPC product without losing any metadata.

 

 

*Note:* No full master or side master unless or until if the relative ISRC is Immersive.

Check for linking as well and add it in this ticket.(Only testing - Register a stereo and link it to a Dolby)

========================================================================

+*TEST CASES FOR QA:*+

*Test Case 1* - Displaying - Open a product check on PD page for the ISRC what all immersive isrc is avialable only those buckets should be displayed
                 i.  Show immersive isrc on immersive master(related isrc) & show stereo isrc on stereo master.
                 ii. Duration - for immersive master the immersive track duration should be displayed & similar for stereo

*Test Case 2* - Registration - Open a product check on PD page for the ISRC what all immersive isrc is avialable only those buckets should be displayed.
                 i. If a product has 10 tracks and only 3 has 360 RA track only those 3 tracks should have select file button.
                 ii. If a product has 10 tracks and only 3 has dolby atmos isrc then those 3 tracks should be registered - As per Rohit for this use case FULL MASTER SIDE should not be displayed.

*Test Case 3* - QC Notes - Create master hieracy on the QC notes;
                 i. Show immersive isrc on immersive master(related isrc) & show stereo isrc on stereo master.
                 ii. when the QC button is clicked from the respective master only the tracks which has an ISRC for that respective master should be displayed. Eg. if only 3 360RA isrc is present in a product of 10 tracks on the QC notes section for 360RA only 3 tracks should be displayed.

*Test Case 4* - Bulk Linking - Linking & Unlinking.
                i. Registering Immersive & linking it to stereo
                i. Registering Stereo & linking it to Immersive                

 

+*Products used by BA & Dev's for testing on stage:*+

STAGE:
G010000244847Q - Stereo Only 
G0100030839754 - Stereo Only Empty master

G0100048573833 - Dolby Only

360Only 

G010004927823F - 360RA product has Dolby - Check with Rohit on the ISRC part 

G010003198417C - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA - Issue UST displaying only stereo 
G010004925584G - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA
G010004878684V - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA
G010004134682B - Stereo product - Has all immersive

G010004878684V - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA empty master

G0100041093413 - 360RA which has virtual immersive + virtual stereo

column1: [BE]UST - Stereo & Immersive - Registration Support - Full Master Side - Immersive & Stereo to the same product/UPC
column28:
*User Story 1:* As a user, I want the “Full Side Master” button to be enabled when all related ISRC are available for all tracks of of immersive, so that I can do a full side master upload.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a stereo product has related ISRC for all the tracks,
*WHEN* I open the stereo product,
*THEN* the “Full Side Master” button is enabled for the immersive master if all related ISRC's are available for all tracks.

*User Story 2:* As a user, I want the “Full Side Master” button to be disabled when related ISRC are not available for all tracks of the stereo product, so that I will not be able to do a full side master uploads.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a stereo product has related ISRC,
*WHEN* I open the stereo product,
*THEN* the “Full Side Master” button is disabled for the immersive master if any related ISRC is not available for any track.

 

*Notes From Refinement 06/05/2025:*

Full Master - Check with Mike on the naming convention, If related isrc is available for track 2 & 3 and if the user is going to upload a folder which is named as 01_xyz & 02_xyz then the system will fail 01_xyz and  02_xyz will be registered to track 2 successfully

Either create a separate ticket for Full master or add it in this ticket.

 

+*TEST CASES FOR QA:*+

*Test Case 1* - Displaying - Open a product check on PD page for the ISRC what all immersive isrc is avialable only those buckets should be displayed
                 i.  Show immersive isrc on immersive master(related isrc) & show stereo isrc on stereo master.
                 ii. Duration - for immersive master the immersive track duration should be displayed & similar for stereo

*Test Case 2* - Registration - Open a product check on PD page for the ISRC what all immersive isrc is avialable only those buckets should be displayed.
                 i. If a product has 10 tracks and only 3 has 360 RA track only those 3 tracks should have select file button.
                 ii. If a product has 10 tracks and only 3 has dolby atmos isrc when a user does a full master side then only those 3 tracks should be registered - As per Rohit for this use case FULL MASTER SIDE should not be disabled 

*Test Case 3* - QC Notes - Create master hieracy on the QC notes;
                 i. Show immersive isrc on immersive master(related isrc) & show stereo isrc on stereo master.
                 ii. when the QC button is clicked from the respective master only the tracks which has an ISRC for that respective master should be displayed. Eg. if only 3 360RA isrc is present in a product of 10 tracks on the QC notes section for 360RA only 3 tracks should be displayed.

*Test Case 4* - Bulk Linking - Linking & Unlinking.
                i. Registering Immersive & linking it to stereo
                i. Registering Stereo & linking it to Immersive                

 

+*Products used by BA & Dev's for testing on stage:*+

STAGE:
G010000244847Q - Stereo Only 
G0100030839754 - Stereo Only Empty master

G0100048573833 - Dolby Only

360Only 

G010004927823F - 360RA product has Dolby - Check with Rohit on the ISRC part 

G010003198417C - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA - Issue UST displaying only stereo 
G010004925584G - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA
G010004878684V - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA
G010004134682B - Stereo product - Has all immersive

G010004878684V - Stereo product - Has dolby & 360RA empty master

G0100041093413 - 360RA which has virtual immersive + virtual stereo
column435:
17/Jun/25 4:27 PM;mham001;In *loadUSTMasterType* endpoint, in *sides* element new field *enableFullMasterSideForImmersive* will be sent.

Rules:
For Immersive mastertype,
      IF enableFullMasterSideForImmersive is true, enable full side master button
      IF enableFullMasterSideForImmersive is false, disable full side master button

For all other mastertypes,
      Ignore enableFullMasterSideForImmersive  flag
;;;

column1: Display CT with short and long descriptions under select destination in MBC
column28:
'+*Description*+
In the MBC interface, when a user clicks Select Destination, the Conversion Types (CT) should be displayed in the same format as on the A3 side. Both the Short Description and the Long Description should be shown. The Long Description should appear in smaller text directly below the Short Description, making it easy for users to distinguish and understand the conversion options.

+*User Story*+
*As a* user,
*I want* to see both the Short Description and the Long Description of Conversion Types under Select Destination,
*so that* I can clearly understand each conversion option without confusion

 

*Current MBC CT design*

!image-2025-09-29-09-53-58-345.png|width=513,height=250!

*Current A3 CT design*

 

!image-2025-09-29-09-55-42-861.png|width=446,height=481!

+*Acceptance Criteria*+

*1. Given* the user is in the MBC interface,
*When* the user clicks on Select Destination,
*Then* the Conversion Types should display both the Short Description and the Long Description.

*2. Given* the A3 side already supports displaying both Short and Long Descriptions,
*When* the user views the Conversion Types in MBC,
*Then* the MBC interface should follow the same design for consistency.
column435: 30/Sep/25 5:11 PM;wang042;Only UI changes is needed;;;

column1: Fix header bar and Apply button position in Select Destination popup
column28:
'+*Description*+


In MBC, when the user clicks on *Select Destination,* a popup window appears. At the top of this popup, there is a blue header bar that contains the popup title (Export) and a close button. Below the blue header bar, there is an Apply button.


Currently, when the user scrolls within the popup, the blue header bar and the Apply button also move along with the scrollbar. This causes the header and apply button to disappear from view.


The expected behavior is that the blue header bar and the Apply button remain fixed in place within the popup. They should always stay visible in the same position, regardless of user scrolling.

!image-2025-09-19-19-08-52-750.png|width=523,height=340!

+*User Story*+

*As a* user,
*I want* the header bar and Apply button in the Select Destination popup to remain fixed in position,
*so that* I can always see the header bar, and easily apply my selection while scrolling.

+*Acceptance Criteria*+


*1. Given* the user opens the Select Destination popup,
*When* the user scrolls up/down the content inside the popup,
*Then* the blue header bar (with title and close button) should remain fixed at the top of the popup.
*2. Given* the user opens the Select Destination popup,
*When* the user scrolls up/down the content inside the popup,
*Then* the Apply button should remain fixed below the blue header bar.

column1: [BE]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - Secondary Validation  - Format
column28:
As a {*}user{*},
I want the system to validate uploaded WAV files for PCM format,
So that only compliant audio assets are registered successfully, and I am guided on corrective actions if the file is invalid.

*Acceptance Criteria*

*Scenario 1: User submits a WAV 16b PCM asset*
 *Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit depth
 *And* clicks *Submit*
 *When* the BE secondary validation checks the file
 *And* the asset is confirmed to be *PCM WAV*
 *Then* the asset registration should {*}pass successfully{*}.

*Scenario 2: User submits a WAV 16 non-PCM asset*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit depth
*And* clicks *Submit*
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the file
*And* the asset is *not PCM WAV*
*Then* the asset registration should *fail*
*And* the following validation message should be displayed:
_“The format of the submitted file %s is not PCM. The submitted asset must be PCM audio.”_
*And* the following suggested corrective message should be displayed:
_“Please review the asset, confirm it is PCM and resubmit for registration._
_Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/”|https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/%E2%80%9D]_

 

*Scenario 3: User submits a WAV 24b PCM or RF64 asset*
 *Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 24-bit depth
 *And* clicks *Submit*
 *When* the BE secondary validation checks the file
 *And* the asset is confirmed to be *PCM or RF64 WAV*
 *Then* the asset registration should {*}pass successfully{*}.

*Scenario 4: User submits a WAV 24b non-PCM or non-RF64 asset*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 24-bit depth
*And* clicks *Submit*
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the file
*And* the asset is *not PCM or RF64 WAV*
*Then* the asset registration should *fail*
*And* the following validation message should be displayed:
_“The format of the submitted file %s is not compliant. The submitted asset must be PCM audio or RF64.”_
*And* the following suggested corrective message should be displayed:
_“Please review the asset, confirm it is either PCM or RF64 and resubmit for registration._
_Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/”|https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/%E2%80%9D]_

 

Notes From Refinement 9.8:

Check with GMP about the RF64 File size validation - Need to confirm. - As per our discussion on the audio call we agreed to remove the 4gb size validation for wav24b

column1: [BE]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24B- Error Button
column28:
*User Story*

As a user registering a Vinyl 16b or 24b asset,
I want the system to automatically display a red error button on the master if any backend validation fails,
So that I can quickly see what went wrong and how to fix it without needing to refresh the browser.

*Acceptance Criteria*
*Scenario 1: Backend validation fails*
*Given* the user has submitted a Vinyl 16b or 24b asset registration request,
*When* one or more secondary (backend) validation checks fail,
*Then* the system should automatically display a red error button on the top-right corner of the master screen,
*And* this should happen in real time without requiring the user to refresh the browser.

*Scenario 2:* Error button click opens error details
*Given* a red error button is displayed on the top-right corner of the master screen,
*When* the user clicks on the red error button,
*Then* a pop-up window should appear,
*And* the pop-up should display all validation errors in red text,
*And* the corresponding solutions or recommendations should be displayed in blue text,
*And* the format and style should be consistent with how errors and solutions are shown on the "cover".

*Scenario 3: No backend validation errors*
*Given* the user has submitted a Vinyl 16b or 24b asset registration request,
*When* all secondary (backend) validation checks pass,
*Then* no red error button should appear on the master screen.

*Scenario 4: Real-time update*
*Given* the user has submitted a Vinyl 16b or 24b asset registration request,
*When* the backend validation completes,
*Then* the system should automatically update the UI (master screen) with the error button if applicable,
*And* this should occur without requiring a manual browser refresh or navigation.

 

+*Notes from 10/6/2025 Refinement:*+ 

This ticket is good to be picked up no changes.

column1: UST - Support For DVD & DDP
[UI]UST - DBKS - Remove Reason For Delete For Failed Assets
column28:
'+*User Story:*+

As a user of the system,
I want to delete DBKS product assets in "Failed" registration status without being prompted for a reason,
So that I can efficiently remove failed assets without unnecessary interaction.

*Acceptance Criteria*
*AC1: No "Reason for Delete" Prompt for Failed Status*

*Given* a user has opened a DBKS product,

*And* the product asset has a registration status of "Failed",

*When* the user clicks on the "x" (delete) button on the left side of the asset,

*Then* the system should not display the "Reason for Delete" pop-up window,

*And* the system should immediately delete the asset from the view.

 

*AC2: Behavior Remains Unchanged for Other Statuses*

*Given* a user is viewing a DBKS product with an asset not in "Failed" status (e.g., "In Progress", "Pending", "Completed", etc.),

*When* the user clicks on the "x" button,

*Then* the system should display the "Reason for Delete" pop-up window as usual.

 

*AC3: UI Feedback Upon Deletion*

*Given* an asset in "Failed" status is deleted via the "x" button,

*When* the deletion is successful,

*Then* the system should immediately remove the asset from the UI (e.g., asset disappears or page refreshes),

And optionally display a brief confirmation message (e.g., "Asset deleted successfully").

column1: [BE]UST - Cover Registration: Re-save JPEG for Undefined Units error
column28:
*User Story:*

As a user uploading an image,
I want the system to validate DPI/PPI at both UI and backend levels,
So that only compliant images (≥72 DPI/PPI) are accepted.

*Acceptance Criteria*
*AC1 - Successful Upload with Valid DPI/PPI(Manual Workflow)*
*Given* the user uploads an image
*And* the UI can read the DPI/PPI
*And* the DPI/PPI is ≥ 72
*When* the user submits the image
*Then* the UI passes the preflight check
*And* the asset is sent to the backend
*And* the backend confirms DPI/PPI is ≥ 72
*Then* the asset is registered successfully

*AC2 - UI Fails Preflight Check (DPI/PPI < 72)*
*Given* the user uploads an image
*And* the UI can read the DPI/PPI
*And* the DPI/PPI is < 72
*Then* the UI blocks submission
*And* displays a DPI/PPI error to the user

*AC3 - UI Cannot Read DPI/PPI*
*Given* the user uploads an image
*And* the UI cannot read the DPI/PPI
*Then* the UI shows a warning, ({*}Warning message:{*} Cover asset must be a minimum 72dpi, the header data of the submitted file is missing this data.)
*And* allows the user to submit the asset

*When* the backend receives the image
*And* the backend reads DPI/PPI ≥ 72
*Then* the asset is registered successfully

*When* the backend reads DPI/PPI and if it is < 72
*Then* the backend rejects the asset

*When* the backend cannot read DPI/PPI
*Then* registration fails with status “Validation Error”{*}(NEED TO CONFIRM WITH MATT) - Before the validation error it goes through Archive In Progress status include that in the AC.{*}
*And* UI shows a red error button
*And* clicking the button shows a popup with the following:
    - Error details
    - Option to Auto Correct(Button)
    - Option to Swap Asset(Button)

*AC4 - Manual Auto-Correct Flow*
*Given* the backend fails registration with Validation Error
*And* the user clicks “Auto Correct” in the error popup
*Then* the backend sets DPI/PPI to 72
*And* stores both original and corrected assets
*And* registers the corrected asset
*And* sends an email to the uploader with:{*}(Update this with the below comments from refinement){*}
    - The corrected asset
    - Notification that the asset was renamed
*Then* the UI displays the corrected asset
*And*  shows an indicator it was auto-corrected on the right side of the asset as displayed on SFV

*AC5 - Asset Swap Flow*
*Given* the user clicks “Swap Asset” in the error popup
*Then* the user is prompted to upload a new image
*And* the validation workflow (UI + backend) is repeated from AC1

*AC6 - Auto-Correct workflow (Permission: UST_AUTOMATED_AUTOCORRECTION)*
*Given* the UI and backend cannot read the DPI/PPI
*And* the user has the permission UST_AUTOMATED_AUTOCORRECTION
*Then* the backend marks the old asset as “Archive In Progress”
*And* UI reflects the same

*When* the user refreshes the page
*Then* UI shows new status as “Auto Correction In Progress”

*Then* the backend auto-corrects the image
*And* sets DPI/PPI to 72
*And* registers the corrected image
*And* sends an email to the uploader

*And*  shows an indicator it was auto-corrected on the right side of the asset as displayed on SFV

 

*AC7 - Email Notification for Auto-Corrected Asset*
*Given* an image is auto-corrected
*When* correction is completed
*Then* an email is sent to the uploader
*And* includes:
    - The corrected asset
    - Message that the asset was renamed

*AC8 - UI Indicator for Auto-Corrected Assets*
*Given* an image is auto-corrected (manually or automatically)
Then the UI should display an icon indicating auto-correction

========================================================

Notes:

Created a separate ticket for download.

Need to add the email template for the notification on this ticket (Mohammed)

+List of email notifications:+

Non Auto system autocorrect:

Once reg fails before auto correct

Once submitted for auto correct - Should we have a notification for this ?

Post auto correct - Can combine it with Registration successful email ?

 

Auto system auto correct:

When asset goes through auto correct.

Post auto correct - Can combine it with Registration successful email ?

 

 

Notes from refinement 9/3 & 9/4: 

Note: If the autocorrect fails it should not be going on a loop for auto correction

+List of email notifications:+

Non Auto system autocorrect:

Once reg fails(Validation error status) before auto correct -Let user know with a message that the user should click on the autocorrect button.

-Once submitted for auto correct - Should we have a notification for this ?-

Post auto correct & Failure - Can combine it with Registration successful email ? - This should be good. (Failure case - AMP is down) - Need to have a scenario for failure (This case can be ignored for testing - FAILURE) 

 

Auto system auto correct:

-When asset goes through auto correct.-

Post auto correct/Failure - Can combine it with Registration successful email ? - This is good

 

Reg. job name - currently it shows the system generated name, 

Update the story with the file resaved name - FILENAME_AUTOCORRECT/AUTOCORRECTED.jpeg - Check with GMP on the case sensitive & the name itself AUTOCORRECT/AUTOCORRECTED  - UST & Reg job will show the new name.

Change the ARCHIVE IN PROGRESS to *TO BE ARCHIVED*

column1: UST - Stereo -  When a master has virtual master linked to it we should be not displaying the entire section (Phase1)
column28:
*Prerequisite:*
 * Open a stereo product on UST
 * Make sure for any of the master type under stereo at least 1 track has a virtual master linked to it.

 

 

*User Story 1:* Hide Master Type with Linked Virtual Master
As a user,
I want the UST to hide any master type under a stereo product that has a virtual master linked to it,
So that I only see relevant master types without linked virtual masters.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a stereo product is loaded on UST,
*WHEN* there are master types linked to a virtual master,
*THEN* those specific master types should not be displayed under the stereo audio section.

*User Story 2:* Display Master Type After Unlinking Virtual Master
As a user,
I want the UST to display a master type again when I unlink the virtual master from it,
So that I can see and register the previously hidden master types.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a master type is currently hidden due to a linked virtual master,
*WHEN* the user unlinks the virtual master from that master type,
*THEN* the master type should become visible under the stereo audio section.

 

NOTE:

Need to add a message to inform the users that its hidden & the reason why its hidden - Get the message from Mike

Update the ticket to all master.

Potentially for May(Black) if not possible for June(Blue).

column1: Fix Issues on Media Batch Converter Status and Export Details Pages
column28:
'+*Description:*+

We need to fix several issues related to the Media Batch Converter Status Page and Export Details Page:

*1. Status Page default data range (no flicker issue)*
When a user with MBC View permission lands on the Media Batch Converter Job Status Page, the view should by default only display the last two days of records (Date Range applied).

Currently, the page briefly flashes all Export Job Status records before reverting to the 2-day filter. This flicker should be fixed. The page must directly load showing only the last two days of records, without displaying all jobs even momentarily. Users should see all records only after they check “Ignore Data Range” and apply the filter.

*2. Missing "Back to List" Button:*
On the AOMA3 Export Status Page, when users click on an Job ID, there should be a Back to List button available. This button was unintentionally removed in the last build and needs to be restored.

*3. Batch Export Details page for Sony CI Imports:*
When users navigate to the Batch Export Details Page for a batch that was initiated via Select Files - Import from Sony CI, the Batch Information table should display the same format as Select Files - Upload from Local, including showing the AMP Asset Key.

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+

*1. Given* the user with MBC View/View All permission navigates to the Media Batch Converter Job Status Page
*When* the page loads
*Then* it should immediately show only the last two days of records by default, without flashing all records first.

*2. Given* the user checks “Ignore Data Range” and applies the filter
*When* the filter is applied
*Then* the page displays all available Export Job Status records.

*3. Given* the user clicks on an Job ID to open the AOMA 3 Export Details page,

*When* the page loads,
*Then* a "Back to List" button should be visible and functional.

*4. Given* a batch was initiated via Select Files - Import from Sony CI,
*When* the user views the Batch Export Details Page,
*Then* the Batch Information table should display the same fields as a Select Files - Upload from Local batch, including the AMP Asset Key.

column1: [DB] Provide Sample ISRCs Returning Multiple Products in Stage
column28:
Hi [~sira001],

*Description*
Please provide a few isrc_ids that return more than one product when using the query below in the stage environment.

We have observed that some ISRCs are returning multiple products, and upon investigation, the duplicate products are not coming from RAAS. I need a similar set of ISRCs in stage to help test and validate that the recent code changes are handling such cases correctly.

Query: 
select t1.catalog_ky as productNumber, t1.isrc_id as isrcId from
(select p.catalog_ky, atm.isrc_id
, RANK() OVER(PARTITION BY atm.isrc_id ORDER BY mt.master_type_id desc,sr.sample_rate_rank desc nulls last,arj.registration_end_time DESC) registration_order_desc
, RANK() OVER(PARTITION BY atm.isrc_id,pm.master_id ORDER BY pl.date_inserted) link_order_asc
,pm.master_id,tm.master_id, mt.master_type_nm, sr.sample_rate_nm, arj.registration_end_time registration_date, pl.date_inserted linked_date
FROM audio_track_masters atm
JOIN masters tm ON tm.master_id=atm.master_id
JOIN master_hierarchies comp_track_hier ON comp_track_hier.child_master_id=atm.master_id
JOIN master_hierarchies prnt_comp_hier ON prnt_comp_hier.child_master_id=comp_track_hier.parent_master_id
JOIN asset_registration_jobs arj ON arj.master_id=prnt_comp_hier.parent_master_id
JOIN masters pm ON pm.master_id=arj.master_id
JOIN master_types mt ON mt.master_type_id=pm.master_type_id
join product_track_links ptl on ptl.master_id=atm.master_id
join product_links pl on pl.product_link_id=ptl.product_link_id
join products p on p.product_id=pl.product_id 
LEFT JOIN sample_rates sr ON sr.sample_rate_id=pm.sample_rate_id
WHERE mt.master_type_id in (2, 30, 34, 41, 8, 7, 75, 39, 40, 3, 42, 104, 101, 103, 1)
AND arj.registration_status_id = 4
AND exists (SELECT 1 FROM all_assets aa WHERE aa.master_id = atm.master_id AND aa.asset_sub_type_id IN (226, 1, 155, 156, 230, 227, 26, 148, 243, 208, 209, 253, 249, 250, 248, 251, 246))
AND exists (SELECT 1 FROM product_tracks pt JOIN performances pf ON pf.performance_id=pt.performance_id WHERE pt.product_track_id=ptl.product_track_id AND pf.isrc_id=atm.isrc_id)
) t1
where t1.registration_order_desc=1 and t1.link_order_asc=1

 
Regards,
Kiran

column1: [UI]UST - Subtitle - Preflight - Wrapper/Extension
column28:
*User Story 1:* Validate .XML File Upload
As a user, I want to upload a file for registration, so that the Preflight check can verify if it is in .XML format.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads a file,
*WHEN* the Preflight Check checks the file extension,
*THEN* if the file is a .XML, the user can proceed to the next step by clicking on the submit button. The preflight check window should have a green tick mark with the text: "Subtitle file is: .xml"
*THEN* if the file is not a .XML, the Preflight check returns a hard failure not allow the user to proceed with the registration and should have the following in the preflight error mesage box: a red exclamatory mark and an error message: “Subtitle assets must have a file extension of xml. The submitted document is not xml.”

*User Story 2:* Provide Validation Corrective Message
As a user, I want to receive corrective messages under the error message when my upload is invalid, so that I can rectify it and resubmit.
**

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the file uploaded is not a XML,
*WHEN* the user receives the validation message,
*THEN* it must include:
{color:#de350b}“Subtitle assets must have a file extension of xml. The submitted document is not xml.” - Check with Mike on the message update it and review{color}
{color:#de350b}“Please ensure your submitted file is .xml and resubmit.”{color}
"Submission Guidelines are found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/video/closed-captions-subtitles/|https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/digital-booklet-standard]."
“If issue persists, please submit to mediaproduction@sonymusic.com to review and attempt to resolve.”

*User Story 3:* User Can Retry Upload after Error
As a user, I want to be able to retry uploading a valid XML file after encountering an error, so that I am not stuck in the upload process.
**

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user receives a validation message,
*WHEN* the user corrects the file extension and attempts to resubmit,
*THEN* the upload process is initiated again for the newly uploaded file.

column1: UST - PreFlight Validations
column28:
UST must have the ability to validate assets before registration/submission via Preflight check functionality.  

Wherever possible when front loading assets to AOMA we would like to be able to inspect/read the assets for any attributes usable for validations and leverage those to throw flags to prevent submission of non-compliant assets.  

Items for Preflight should be as follows: 
 * Track timings (duration) - Already Done 
 * Bit Depth 
 * Samplerate 
 * Wrapper/Extension 
 * Format/Codec 
 * Channel Count
 * Individual stereo selection
 * *Multiple WAV files per component (FY 2026)*

Validations should be added to the validation worksheet: [RegistrationValidation_Worksheet.xlsx|https://sonymusicentertainment-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/personal/michael_catandella_sonymusic_com/Documents/GMP_Operational%20Documents/Project_Folder/AOMA/Registration_Validations/RegistrationValidation_Worksheet.xlsx?d=w8a087c5dbaa946d4a624ae2789452116&csf=1&web=1&e=CEhoeY] 

Each validation criteria will be noted along with PreFlight requirements for Pass, Fail, Warnings, and messaging.

column1: [UI]UST - Stereo - Wav 16b & 24b - PreFlight - Format
column28:
*User Story 1*
As a user registering a wav 16b or 24b assets,
I want the system to validate the asset format during preflight check before submission,
So that I can avoid submitting an asset that does not meet the required format.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user selects a wav 16b or 24b asset,
*WHEN* the preflight check is initiated,
*THEN* the system should validate the format of the asset.

*User Story 2*
As a user,
I want to see a disabled “Submit” button when my asset format is incorrect,
So that I understand that I cannot proceed with the registration.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a WAV asset that is neither PCM nor RF64,
*WHEN* the preflight check is completed,
*THEN* the “Submit” button should be greyed out and disabled.

*User Story 3*
As a user,
I want to receive an error message when my asset format is invalid,
So that I am informed about what needs to be fixed before submission.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* that the asset format is incorrect,
*WHEN* the preflight check fails,
*THEN* a red exclamatory icon should be displayed in the preflight message section with the message: “The format of the submitted file %s is not PCM or RF64. The submitted asset must be PCM or RF64 audio.”

*User Story 4*
As a user,
I want to see a suggested corrective action when my asset’s format is invalid,
So that I know how to properly format my asset for successful registration.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* that the asset format is incorrect,
*WHEN* the preflight check fails,
*THEN* the user should see the suggested corrective action: "Please review the asset, confirm it is PCM or RF64 and resubmit for registration. Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/]."

column1: [BE]UST - Subtitle - Secondary Validation - Wrapper/Extension
column28:
*User Story 1:* Validate file Format
As a user, I want the system to validate the uploaded asset’s file format so that I can be informed whether my submission meets the required specifications.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads an asset,
*WHEN* the file format is ..xml,
*THEN* the asset should be accepted and pass the backend validation.

*User Story 2:* Display Validation Message for Incorrect Format
As a user, I want to receive a clear error message when my uploaded asset is not in .xml format so that I know what corrective actions to take.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads an asset,
*WHEN* the file format is not .xml
*THEN* the system should fail the registration and display the following message:
“The asset submitted is not xml as required.”
“Please submit a .xml format.”
“Submission Guidelines are found here: https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/video/closed-captions-subtitles/”
“If issue persists, please submit to mediaproduction@sonymusic.com to review and attempt to resolve.”

*User Story 3:* Provide Submission Guidelines Link
As a user, I want the error message to include a link to submission guidelines so that I can easily access the necessary information for correcting my submission.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads an incorrect asset format,
*WHEN* the validation fails,
*THEN* the error message should include a clickable link to the Submission Guidelines at “https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/video/closed-captions-subtitles/.

column1: Promote “Package Printing Specifications” and “Video Metadata” to Engineering menu
column28:
'+*Description*+


Phase 1: Move two existing submenu items from *Engineering -- QC Metadata* out to top-level items directly under Engineering:
• Package Printing Specifications
• Video Metadata


Behavior for both must be identical to launching them from QC Metadata today (same pages, same feature capabilities), and must remain controlled by the same permissions.


Phase 2 : Once the two items function as top-level Engineering menu entries, retire the QC Metadata module entirely:
• Remove QC Metadata from the Engineering menu (DB change).
• Perform code cleanup

 

!QC Metadata.png|width=609,height=392!

+*User Story*+

*As a* user with the appropriate permissions, 

*I want* Package Printing Specifications and Video Metadata accessible directly under the Engineering menu 

*so that* I can reach them faster, while retiring the obsolete QC Metadata section to reduce confusion.



+*Acceptance Criteria:*+

AC1: Top-level menu entries appear
*Given* I have a permission that grants me access to Package Printing Specifications or Video Metadat
*When* I open the Engineering menu
*Then* I see Package Printing Specifications and Video Metadata as separate top-level entries under Engineering.

AC2 — Same functionality
*Given* I launch either Package Printing Specifications or Video Metadata from the Engineering menu entries
*When* the page loads
*Then* the feature set, page layout, available actions are identical to the prior behavior when launched from QC Metadata.

AC3 — Permissions unchanged
*Given* my account lacks the permission that previously restricted access to one or both features
*When* I open the Engineering menu or attempt to navigate directly via URL
*Then* menu entries should be hidden and  direct URL access denied with the same error

column1: [BE]UST - Registering Immersive To A Stereo Product - Need To Delete The Flag
[BE]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - Secondary Validation - Extesnsio/Wrapper
column28:
As a {*}user{*},
I want the system to validate that uploaded audio files have the correct .wav extension/wrapper,
So that only compliant WAV audio assets are registered successfully, and I receive clear guidance when corrections are required.

*Acceptance Criteria*

*Scenario 1: User submits a 16/24b asset with .wav extension*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit or 24-bit depth
*And* the file has the *.wav extension*
*And* clicks *Submit*
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the file wrapper/extension
*And* the extension is confirmed as .wav
*Then* the asset registration should {*}pass successfully{*}.

*Scenario 2: User submits a 16/24b asset without .wav extension*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit or 24-bit depth
*And* the file does *not* have a .wav extension/wrapper
*And* clicks *Submit*
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the file wrapper/extension
*And* the extension is *not .wav*
*Then* the asset registration should *fail*
*And* the following validation message should be displayed:
_“The extension of the submitted file %s is not .wav. This asset type must be .wav”_
*And* the following suggested corrective action should be displayed:
_“Please review the asset, confirm it is .wav and resubmit for registration._
_Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/”|https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/%E2%80%9D]_

Submission Guidelines - Media Guide

Submission Format Guidelines Sony Music accepts a variety of formats for ingestion--see below for our accepted formats and approved delivery specifications. Not sure about what deliverables to subm...

 

Notes From Refinement 9.8:

AMP not sending the extension info, Need to capture that, Update the AMP ticket

column28:
As cover art is registered we often find errors with assets. 
 * Missing header data
 * Incorrect format (png in jpg wrapper) 
 * Bit depth
 * Color space
 * wrapper/extension
 * Resolution/Dimensions
 * DPI/PPI

We would like to explore and build workflows to auto-correct these issues to be implemented into the AOMA registration workflow. 

User submits asset, asset fails validation, user has an option to select auto-correct for the system to attempt to correct the issue. - AOMA needs to come up with a solution for this

Note: we also need to cover the use case where no header data is available in this scenario we need to auto correct as well, We need to explore this option using the Tiffany tool which Matt.C had developed if there are any other approach please update it here.

Also this is dependent on the imagemagick version upgrade.

column1: Restrict file type uploads based on selected radio button in MBC select files
column28:
'+*Description:*+

In the MBC interface, when users choose to “Select Files” for batch export, they must first select one of the three radio buttons: Audio, Video, or Graphics. Based on the selected option, the system should only allow files of the corresponding type to be uploaded—regardless of whether they are imported via Sony CI or uploaded from Local Upload. If users attempt to upload a file of an incorrect type (e.g. uploading a Video file while Audio is selected), the system should block the upload and display an error notification popup in the top-right corner.

!image-2025-08-04-23-26-30-132.png|width=537,height=223!

*audio: wav*

*video: mov*

*graphics: jpg, jpeg*

 

+*User Story:*+

*As a* user of MBC,
*I want* the system to restrict uploads to only the file type corresponding to the selected radio button,
*so that* I do not accidentally upload mismatched file types.

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+

1. Audio Selected:
*Given* the user has selected the “Audio” radio button — only .wav is supported for Audio
    *And* the user uploads files via either Sony CI or Local Upload
*When* the uploaded files are of non-audio type (video or graphics)
*Then* the system should block the upload
    *And* display an error message popup in the top-right corner

2. Graphics Selected:
*Given* the user has selected the “Graphics” radio button — only .jpg and .jpeg are supported for graphics
    *And* the user uploads files via either Sony CI or Local Upload
*When* the uploaded files are of non-graphics type (audio or video)
*Then* the system should block the upload
    *And* display an error message popup in the top-right corner

3. Video Selected:
*Given* the user has selected the “Video” radio button — only .mov is supported for Video
    *And* the user uploads files via either Sony CI or Local Upload
*When* the uploaded files are of non-video type (audio or graphics)
*Then* the system should block the upload
    *And* display an error message popup in the top-right corner

column1: Analysis - UST - Support For Packaging Graphics
Clickable Batch ID in MBC Submission
column28:
'+*Background:*+

Currently, when a user submits a Media Batch Converter job, a pop-up window appears displaying the generated Batch ID. However, this Batch ID is not clickable, requiring users to manually navigate to the Export Status UI and enter the Batch ID to check the status. To improve usability,  the Batch ID should be clickable, and clicking it should redirect the user to the Export Status UI, where the Batch ID filter is already applied, displaying only the relevant batch details.

Currently users have two options to upload files:

1. Assets from AOMA – allows selection of assets directly from the AOMA system

2. Select Files(s) – allows upload of files from the local device

Currently, after submission:

• The *Assets from AOMA* option displays *a single toast message* showing the Batch ID upon successful submission.

• The *Select Files* option displays *multiple toast messages — one for each individual file in the batch.*

This inconsistent behavior can confuse users. To improve the user experience, the toast message behavior for the Select File(s) option should be updated to match the Assets from AOMA  — to display a single toast message indicating the batch has been submitted along with the Batch ID.

+*User Story:*+

*As a* user,
*I want* the Batch ID displayed in the Media Batch Converter submission pop-up to be clickable,
*So that* I can quickly access the Export Status UI with the Batch ID pre-filtered, avoiding the need for manual input.

!image-2025-03-11-17-27-45-176.png|width=815,height=200!

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+

*1. Given* a user submits a batch using the Media Batch Converter,
*When* the submission is completed,
*Then* a pop-up window should display the generated Batch ID, and the Batch ID should be clickable.

*2. Given* a user sees the pop-up window with the Batch ID,
*When* the user clicks on the Batch ID,

*Then* the system should redirect the user to the MBC Job Status UI,
        *And* the Batch ID filter should be automatically applied,
        *And* the filtered results should display only the details related to the selected Batch ID.

*3. Given* a user is redirected to the MBC Job Status UI,
*When* the page loads,
*Then* the page should be pre-filtered with the Batch ID from the pop-up,
        *And* the MBC job batch details should be correctly displayed based on the applied filter.

column1: Fail Asset Registration Job when AMP fails an upload
column28:
{*}Desc:{*}{*}{*}

When AMP fails a UST upload (timeout/validation) we should also fail the assetRegistrationJob. There is checks in UST/legacy that will not allow a user to register a new upload without clearing the arJobs status.

column1: Bug Fix: Cover/dbs assetRegistrationJob discrepancies
column28:
*Desc:*

Cover has some weird UST interactions due to its initial design being hybrid with legacy in terms of registration jobs. It would always required a new arJob to be created on an upload where as other masters will re-use jobs unless the master is purged. Asset Swap seems to also be bugged where we new job and dont clear the old job when he swap completes. DBKS which was designed like UST has also inherited some of these issues.

*AC:*
 * We should fix cover/dbks to behave more like the other masters where we only create new job when the old one is purged 
 ** Purged will generally occur when the last asset is fully unregistered
 * AssetSwap should use the existing job instead of creating a new job

 

*Dev Notes:*
 * Check with db team if this could have caused any issues in prod

column1: Modify how UST loads prod configurations
column28:
*Desc:*

Currently UST maintains a list of product configurations and what display mapping they should have. This however means we need to update these lists as we add new masterTypes.

Instead we should purely be taking the supported masterTypes from those product configs and deciding the displays that should show up from that list. 

*Dev Notes:*
 * We will probally still hide stereo sections from mixed media configs until we handle load better. Should test how this behaves before blocking through
 ** Concern is configs that have side 1 video and side 2 audio. UST was not designed well around these configs 

 

Notes From Refinement 9/16:

Question - Are we opening the floodgates for 

For now we should not introduce until all the functionalities like QC workflow etc... works   

Currently there's no much combo products - So any combo products which we are blacklisting  will not be displayed.

Don't display virtual 

Blacklist unsupported masters -> via db

column1: UI: SONY CI Video Close Werid Interaction
column28:
*Desc:*

If a user clicks the SONY CI option for SFV and closes out the selector window instead of closing out the pop up we get re-directed to the pre-upload pop up with invalid data. (See below). Instead if the user is closing the SONY CI window we should back out of everything.

!image-2025-04-30-16-39-40-946.png!

column1: Cover Legacy load fix for masters that have back cover
column28:
*Desc:*

There is a bug where is a cover master has a both a F and back cover, it does load correctly into UST. While UST doesn't support these back covers we should still load the cover master with the F information.

 

*Dev Notes:*
 * Bug is due to an all_assets call that is expecting one result when attempting to create the ust migrated asset. We should adjust to filter for the front cover.

column1: Refactor where wav16 parent master/file package is created for full master down convert
column28:
*Desc:*

When a wav 24 is uploaded we allow a user to downconvert the master for a wav 16 registration. When doing this as part of the full master option however there is a chance that two of wav 24 masters finish at the same exact time, which can cause an issue with the db creation for some of the entries as both try to create the same entry. 

We need to modify where the wav 16 parent master information is created for full master workflows. If the downconvert flag is true in for a full master and at least one of the wav 24 master is valid, we can create the wav 16 master basic information as part of that process. It's single threaded at that point so we don't need to worry about tracks crisscrossing.

column1: Adjust how validate swap behaves
column28:
*Desc:*

We need to improve how the query look up behaves for the validateUserAccessForSwap call when attempting to swap assets. We had a case where a master was virtually linked to over 100+ different virtual masters which caused the load to time out. Rather then manually looping the SG master checks we should work with db team for better queries to get what we are looking for.

column1: [BE}MBC - Support For Mobile Cover Products
column28:
*User Story: Mobile Product Search - Cover Products*
As a user, I want to search for mobile products so that I can find mobile covers that are available to be exported to Sony CI.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user is on the MBC interface and has entered a product on the search box which is a mobile product,
*WHEN* the user submits the search,
*THEN* the search results should include mobile products that are covers.

*User Story: Mobile Product Search - Non-Cover Products*
As a user, I want to search for mobile products so that I can be informed when a searched product is not a mobile cover.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user is on the MBC interface and has entered product in the search box which is or are mobile products,
*WHEN* the user submits the search and the result does not include any mobile cover products,
*THEN* the search results should not display those products, and an info icon should appear on the right hand corner stating “This product is not a mobile cover.”

*User Story: Export Search Results for Cover Products*
As a user, I want to export the search results of mobile cover products so that It gets delivered to Sony Ci.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user has a list of mobile cover products in the search results,
*WHEN* the user exports these products,
*THEN* the list of mobile cover products should be exported to Sony CI.

column1: Estimation For Mix Stems & Mix Passes
column28:
This story is to analyze the requirements.

column1: UST Registration is not sending GRAS Usage/Topic messages for Virtually Linked Products

It was noticed that in the SaveToDatabaseHelperService we are deciding on which products get messages send out purely just on the full master links. However when comparing it to the legacy logic (registrationJobProcessor) it looks like we should be also gather up the virtual product links as well. 

*Desc:*

Analysis should be done on the legacy registration registrationJobProcessor and saveToDb for the usage/topic logic and then the revelant code change should be made.

*Dev Notes:*
 * SaveToDatabaseHelperService (Line 253)
 ** I believe this should be modified to search for all productLinks tied to the product not just the parentMaster
 * AssetUnregistrationHelperService gets virtual master links by going through the productTrackLinks

column1: UST - Audio -  MFiT registration, Once the master is registered clicking QC notes brings up the Mastering Engineer Email entry pop up
column28:
UST MFiT registration,

I registered the MFiT master on this product G010005258283V with no issue. 

Entering the Security Group, then Mastering Engineer Detail and uploading and reg all worked correctly.

Once the master is registered clicking QC notes tab brings up the Mastering Engineer Email entry pop-up and not the QC notes. 

I was able to work around this by entering and locking QC notes in the aoma 3 product page. 

 

Notes from Testing: - When we initially register an asset it asks for the mastering engineer which we select post which the register pop up screen shows up where we select the priority and then submit for registration. Once registered when we click on the QC notes button it again brings up the mastering engineer pop up and we need to select an email and save it before we get into the QC Notes - Need to check why cant the 1st time when we select the mastering engineer be saved and why should we bring it up on the QC notes as well. Tested on dev G010001766392X

 

Notes from Refinement:

This should be implemented for the QC notes button only, If an asset is registered and if the master engineer is selected during registration., 
If the master engineer contact is not null the master engineer pop up should not be showing up.

BE should send master engineer contact on top of the load call

Needs both BE & UI

column1: Use AMP endpoint to get errorCode
column28:
*Desc:*

AMP has introduced errorCodes with their error messages via an endpoint. Utilizing this will allow us more customization with the error messages we get from amp.

column1: SFV Submission Validation for Defaulting to Square Pixel
column28:
On submission of a video asset via UST a user has an option to manually select a value for "Aspect Ratio" in the interface via a dropdown menu. 

This function mainly exists for SD size type content to specify the pixel aspect ratio. 

The *Scope* of this story is to validate and update the available choices a user makes for Aspect Ratio in UST. When an HD, 2K or 4k Size type is chosen, it becomes Square Pixel. When it is not a System Default or a Square Pixel, it will revert the data to Square Pixel.

 

The *Values* available within the  Aspect Ratio field should be System Default  Aspect Ratio fields may be (for SD) :" 4x3 Full-frame", "4x3 Letterbox", "16x9 Widescreen", System Default,.

 

The Acceptance Criteria:

*When* are user submits an HD, 2K and 4K size type, it should always be "Square Pixel" (see UST-1333)

*When* a user selects a value that is not "system default" and "not VGA square / Square Pixel" *Then*  AOMA will validate the value as selected in this field and

*When* it is incorrect for these size types, *Then* AOMA will revert the data to "Square Pixel"
