column1: Update Auto-Validation Message for dimensions hard fail
column28:
*Desc:*

Currently if both the width or height do not match any accepted dimensions in AOMA system, the video goes straight to Manual QC. The solution message suggests it can be auto-corrected which in this case it can not so this needs to be updated.

 

*Dev Notes:*
 * This should have its own messaging rather then sharing the existing one dimension mismatch message

column1: UST Stereo - Add block with override for timing validation error in UST
column28:
Direct upload will prompt a user in the event of a timing discrepancy of more than 10 seconds and force the user to either cancel the upload or override the warning and proceed. UST just registers the asset and displays a timing discrepancy. UST's behavior should be modified to match Direct Upload. The warning/override helps detect and avoid errors.

 

Analysis:

UST just registers the asset and just shows the highlighted in red 
!image-2024-07-18-09-08-56-794.png!

Simple upload does not throw an error

 

Direct upload displays this once upload is completed and the submit button is clicked

!image-2024-07-18-09-14-06-061.png!

User is asking the same error message as what we see on the direct upload

Refinement call notes 7/18:

This needs to be considered for full master & full master side, Be needs to do an analysis to figure out how we are going to support this, In regards to pre flight, Pre flight does not support folders so this cannot be handled on the pre flight side.

column1: UST Stereo - Uploading 24 bit to incorrect sample rate can duplicate an existing master ID
column28:
In testing UST uploads, I intentionally attempted to load a 24/44.1 wav to the 24/192. The system failed it, but all attempts to upload to the correct 24/44.1 bucket failed after that attempt. The UST bucket for 24/192 was given the same master ID as the 24/44.1 bucket (5478670). I'll try and see if I can give more info, but this appears to be a glitch.

. The system is failing with this error:
|*Description:*|The sample rate (192kHz) for master 5478670 doesn't match with the sample rate (44.1kHz) of wav asset file FooFighters_TheEssentialFooFighters_G010004902471V_01_05_MonkeyWrench_USRW29600001.wav.|

column1: [BE] Pending- Aspera Download: Set filenaming convention for downloadable 360 RA object folders
column28:
*Business Value:* We need to update the file naming convention for when downloading from UST, so that it is easier to identify business assets when they are downloaded in any and all available forms. UST prefers "original" filenames, but A3 details page is adding options for Short and Long Name. These potentially can be added on the UST side too.

*Description:* Once the change is implemented then the file name will be in the following format: Track Title (Master display)_Master ISRC_Master Type_Object Package Number (no of objects)

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Given a track file is available on AOMA to be downloaded

When the file is downloaded using the 360 RA object folder

Then it will follow the following naming convention:
 * _*Track Title (Master display)_Master ISRC_Master Type_Object Package Number (no of objects)*_
 * _*Ex:*_ 01_AsiEsLaVida_USSD12300559_360RA_5Object (PROD Product G010005156809O)

*Pre-conditions:*

-User is downloading 360 RA object folder

column1: [UI] Remove duration mismatch QC Lock message for 360 RA masters
column28:
*User story:* When QC Notes are locked for immersive masters, there are messages that show when there are mismatches between conflicting durations and ISRC's, from GRPS/label copy and from saved track master data. Currently for 360 RA masters, since they have a different folder structure compared to other masters, and because they have not migrated to Cloud, there are no duration mismatches to capture and display to the user. As such, the duration mismatch message needs to stop displaying to the user.

*Pre-conditions:*

-User is on UST and is uploading/registering *360 RA assets*

-User is trying to lock QC Notes from UST interface

*Acceptance Criteria:*

-The duration mismatch message should be removed for *360 RA assets ONLY* when locking QC Notes, due to durations being unable to be captured.

-Discuss if the duration mismatch should also no longer show on the column? (This is an outstanding question)

 

Example of duration mismatch showing in pre-lock modal (remove duration mismatch message)

!image-2023-04-21-09-19-44-497.png|width=424,height=246!

 

Example of duration mismatch showing in column

column1: Single Track downconvert multiple wav 16 bug
column28:
*Desc:*

On a brand new product, if a user somehow submits two single file uploads wav 24 downconverts at the same time there is a chance that the BE will get confused when creating the new wav 16 master (I can think it needs to create a new one twice if they hit the same time).

It may make sense to check/create the wav 16 parent master in the Front End service if downconvert is selected for a single track upload.
column331: Tickets To Make Matt Life Easy

column1: [BE]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - Secondary Validation - Channel Count
column28:
As a {*}user{*},
I want the system to validate that uploaded WAV files are stereo (2-channel),
So that only compliant stereo audio assets are registered successfully, and I am guided on corrective actions if the file is invalid.


*Acceptance Criteria*

*Scenario 1: User submits a WAV 16/24b asset with 2 channels (Stereo)*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit or 24-bit depth
*And* clicks *Submit*
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the file
*And* the channel count is exactly *2*
*Then* the asset registration should {*}pass successfully{*}.

*Scenario 2: User submits a WAV 16/24b asset with channel count not equal to 2*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit or 24-bit depth
*And* clicks *Submit*
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the file
*And* the channel count is *not equal to 2*
*Then* the asset registration should *fail*
*And* the following validation message should be displayed:
-“WAV asset file %s has a channel count of %s which is currently not allowed. WAV file assets must be Stereo (contain two channels of audio).”_
*And* the following suggested corrective action should be displayed:
-“Please fix the channel count before resubmitting.

column1: [BE]UST - Vinyl 16B - Secondary Validation - Sample Rate
column28:
As a user,
I want to validate the sample rate of uploaded 16-bit WAV files,
So that only files with supported sample rates (44.1kHz or 48kHz) are accepted for processing.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*AC1 – Validate Sample Rate on Upload*
*Given* a user uploads a 16-bit WAV file,
*When* the system inspects the file's sample rate,
*Then* it must check whether the sample rate is exactly 44.1kHz or 48kHz.

*AC2 – Reject Unsupported Sample Rate*
*Given* the uploaded 16-bit WAV file has a sample rate not equal to 44.1kHz or 48kHz,
*When* the backend processes the file,
*Then* the upload asset must fail registration with a validation error message in the following format:
"Wav 16 masters only support sample rates of 44.1khz OR 48khz. The provided wav asset file %s has a sample rate of %s."
*And* the system must return the following suggested corrective message:
"Please upload an asset of sampleRate 44.1khz OR 48khz"

*AC3 – Accept Supported Sample Rates*
*Given* the uploaded 16-bit WAV file has a sample rate of 44.1kHz or 48kHz,
*When* the backend validates the file,
*Then* the upload asset must pass registration the sample rate validation step and proceed to the next stage in processing.

 

Notes From Refinement 9.8:

Check with GMP if we can have the same messages for stereo & vinyl

column1: [UI]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - PreFlight Validation - 10" Vinyl Extended Play 10" Vinyl Single 10" Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3 - Duration
column28:
As a user,I want to validate the duration of 10" vinyl master files based on their RPM and format,
So that users are warned when their submissions exceed the recommended limits, allowing for better planning and manufacturing accuracy.

Applicable Formats (Triggers Validation)

10" Vinyl Extended Play

10" Vinyl Single

10" Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*AC1 – Accept Valid Duration for 45 RPM (≤ 9 min)*
*Given* a user uploads a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit),
*And* the RPM is 45,
*And* the duration of a side is ≤ 9 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation without warning.

*AC2 – Pass with Warning for 45 RPM (> 9 min)*
*Given* a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit) with RPM = 45,
*And* the duration of a side > 9 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation,
*And* return the following warning message:

"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 10 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

 

Component 1 Side A master is xx:xx:xx long

Component 1 Side B master is xx:xx:xx long

 

Recommended side lengths for 10 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 9 minutes

 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 12 minutes "

*AC3 – Accept Valid Duration for 33 1/3 RPM (≤ 12 min)*
*Given* a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit) with RPM = 33 1/3,
*And* the duration of a side ≤ 12 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation without warning.

*AC4 – Pass with Warning for 33 1/3 RPM (> 12 min)*
*Given* a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit) with RPM = 33 1/3,
*And* the duration of a side > 12 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation,
*And* return the following warning message (same as 45 RPM case):

"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 10 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

 

Component 1 Side A master is xx:xx:xx long

Component 1 Side B master is xx:xx:xx long

 

Recommended side lengths for 10 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 9 minutes

 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 12 minutes "

 

Notes for user story:
Applicable Formats (Trigger Validation):

10" Vinyl Extended Play

10" Vinyl Single

10" Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3

Validation Logic:

RPM      Recommended Max Duration      Behavior If Within Limit      Behavior If Exceeds Limit
45                   9 minutes                                       Pass                              Pass with Warning
33 1/3            12 minutes                                     Pass                              Pass with Warning

Warning Message (for both cases exceeding recommended duration):

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 10 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended. 
Recommended side lengths for 10 inch vinyl: 
 - @45 rpm up to 9 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 12 minutes

 

Notes From Refinement 9.8:

All good with the AC.

Jack - Need to get sample assets & products for each config - Check with Vitaly he has all the sample assets. 

Add an analysis ticket for both UI & BE for Vinyl validation for preflight.

*Given* a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit) with RPM = 45,
*And* the duration of a side > 9 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation,
*And* return the following warning message:

"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 10 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.{*}>>PASS{*}
*!image-2025-09-19-16-27-37-868.png|width=788,height=285!*

*AC3 – Accept Valid Duration for 33 1/3 RPM (≤ 12 min)*
*Given* a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit) with RPM = 33 1/3,
*And* the duration of a side ≤ 12 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation without warning.{*}>>PASS{*}

*AC4 – Pass with Warning for 33 1/3 RPM (> 12 min)*
*Given* a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit) with RPM = 33 1/3,
*And* the duration of a side > 12 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation,
*And* return the following warning message (same as 45 RPM case):{*}>>PASS{*}
*!image-2025-09-19-16-31-03-623.png|width=769,height=278!*;;;

column1: [UI]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - PreFlight Validation -7" Vinyl Single7" Vinyl EP 33 1/37" Vinyl Extended Play 45 - Duration
column28:
*User Story:*
As a user uploading or reviewing a vinyl master,
I want to be warned if a side of a 7-inch vinyl exceeds recommended time limits for its speed (RPM),
So that I can proactively contact the cutting facility or make changes before finalizing the master.

*Acceptance Criteria* 

*AC1 - Warn When Side Length Exceeds Limit for 7” @ 45 RPM*
*Given* a user registers a master for a 7-inch vinyl
*And* the selected speed is 45 RPM
*And* a side length exceeds 4 minutes 30 seconds
*Then* the system displays a warning:
"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 7 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

 

Component 1 Side A master is xx:xx:xx long

Component 1 Side B master is xx:xx:xx long

 

Recommended side lengths for 7 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds

 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes "

*AC2 - Warn When Side Length Exceeds Limit for 7” @ 33 1/3 RPM*
*Given* a user registers a master for a 7-inch vinyl
*And* the selected speed is 33 1/3 RPM
*And* a side length exceeds 7 minutes
*Then* the system displays a warning:

"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 7 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

 

Component 1 Side A master is xx:xx:xx long

Component 1 Side B master is xx:xx:xx long

 

Recommended side lengths for 7 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds

 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes "

 

*AC3 - Do Not Show Warning When Within Limits*
*Given* a user registers a master for a 7-inch vinyl
*And* the selected speed is 45 RPM
*And* each side is ≤ 4 minutes 30 seconds
*Or* the selected speed is 33 1/3 RPM
*And* each side is ≤ 7 minutes
*Then* no warning is displayed

*AC4 - Side-Specific Warning*
*Given* only one side (e.g. Side A) exceeds the limit
*Then* the warning only references that specific side (e.g. “Side A”)
*And* does not reference other sides that are within limits

 

 

Notes From Refinement 9.8:

All good with the AC.

Jack - Need to get sample assets & products for each config - Check with Vitaly he has all the sample assets.

column1: DB Task: New column in ust_event_email_tracking for ust_event_type

We want to add a new column to ust_event_email_tracking named ust_event_type. This new column will keep track of what type of email UST is sending out. This requires no backfill since existing entries are already processed so any process entries can be left null (also we should allow null so we don't need to backfill).

With this new column  can we also create the corresponding enum db table for the following ust_event_types
 # Registration Notification
 # AQC Notification

Let me know if you have any questions. 

Thanks

Matthew

column1: [UI]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - PreFlight Validation  - Format
column28:
As a {*}user{*},
I want the system to validate uploaded WAV files for PCM format,
So that only compliant audio assets are registered successfully, and I am guided on corrective actions if the file is invalid.

*Acceptance Criteria*

*Scenario 1: User submits a WAV 16b PCM asset*
 *Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit depth
 *When* the PreFlight validation checks the file
 *And* the asset is confirmed to be *PCM WAV*
 *Then* the *Submit* button should {*}be enabled{*}.

*And* the pass message should be displayed

*Scenario 2: User submits a WAV 16 non-PCM asset*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit depth
*When* the PreFlight validation checks the file
*And* the asset is *not PCM WAV*
*Then* the *Submit* button should *not* {*}be enabled{*}.
*And* the following validation message should be displayed with a red exclamatory mark on the left side:
_“The format of the submitted file %s is not PCM. The submitted asset must be PCM audio.”_
*And* the following suggested corrective message should be displayed:
_“Please review the asset, confirm it is PCM and resubmit for registration._
_Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/”|https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/%E2%80%9D]_

 

*Scenario 3: User submits a WAV 24b PCM or RF64 asset*
 *Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 24-bit depth
 *When* the PreFlight validation checks the file
 *And* the asset is confirmed to be *PCM or RF64 WAV*

*Then* the *Submit* button should {*}be enabled{*}.

*And* the pass message should be displayed 

 

*Scenario 4: User submits a WAV 24b non-PCM or non-RF64 asset*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 24-bit depth
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the file
*And* the asset is *not PCM or RF64 WAV*
*Then* the *Submit* button should *not be enabled*
*And* the following validation message should be displayed with a red exclamatory mark on the left side:
_“The format of the submitted file %s is not compliant. The submitted asset must be PCM audio or RF64 if larger than 4GB._
*And* the following suggested corrective message should be displayed:
_“Please review the asset, confirm it is either PCM or RF64 and resubmit for registration._
_Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/”|https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/%E2%80%9D]_

column1: [UI]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - PreFlight Validation - Channel Count
column28:
As a {*}user{*},
I want the system to validate that uploaded WAV files are stereo (2-channel),
So that only compliant stereo audio assets are registered successfully, and I am guided on corrective actions if the file is invalid.

*TESTING NOTE - this has only been implemented for TusD upload*

*Acceptance Criteria*

*Scenario 1: User submits a WAV 16/24b asset with 2 channels (Stereo)*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit or 24-bit depth
*When* the PreFlight validation checks the file
*And* the channel count is exactly *2*
*Then* the preflight validation should *pass successfully And* the *Submit* button should be enabled.

*Scenario 2: User submits a WAV 16/24b asset with channel count not equal to 2*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit or 24-bit depth
*When* the PreFlight validation checks the file
*And* the channel count is *not equal to 2*
*Then* the *Submit* button should be *greyed out*
*And* the following validation message should be displayed:
_“submitted file %s has a channel count not equal to ‘2’ which is currently not allowed. This asset type must be Stereo (contain two channels of audio).”_
*And* the following suggested corrective action should be displayed:
_“Please review the asset, confirm it is stereo (2 channel) and resubmit for registration._
_Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/”|https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/%E2%80%9D]_

 

Notes From Refinement 9.8:

All good with the AC.

Jack - Need to get sample assets & products for each config - Check with Vitaly he has all the sample assets.

column1: Fail auto-correct if black tail can not be fixed
column28:
*Desc:*

If a user uploads an all black image the auto-correct will process the image as expected but the black detection will not understand that its been added. In this scenario a user can infinitely auto-correct and if they have the automated auto correct permission it can lead to issues. We should fail the automated auto-correct scenario if its the 2nd time were seeing this file via the auto-correct workflow.

 

{*}QA Testing:{*}{*}{*}
 # Verify normal registration of an SFV
 # Verify an auto-correction case where asset is successful post auto-correction and doesn't have automated auto-correct
 # Verify an auto-correction case where asset is successful post auto-correction and proceeds through automated auto-correct
 # Verify manual qc process (direct to manual qc/auto-correction failed)
 # Verify GMP file (All black file that looped black tail detection) goes to manual qc post inital auto-correct. (I can provide the file)

column1: DB Task: Add new columns to Automated QC Notes
column28:
Hi db team,

We are currently working on some enhancements for the automated qc notes error messages we generate for the users. We want to add a warning/error status, an enhanced warning/error message and a suggested corrective action message. 

As such can we add the follow three columns (names we can change though):
 * Validation Status (not in love with the name)
 ** This field would need to contain the following statuses:
 *** Fail, with warning
 *** Pass, with warning,
 *** Pass
 ** We can either have a separate enum table for the above statuses or this can be a text field
 * Validation Message 
 ** Text field 
 ** {*}Ex message{*}: The file submitted appears to be created from a lower fidelity source. Frequency content only extends to %% while Aoma expects 22.05kHz from a 44.1kHz file. 
 * Validation Corrective Action
 ** Text field
 ** *Ex message:* The file should be resupplied at it’s native sample rate.
If this is the only source available you may choose to leave as-is.{*}{*}

Let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Thanks

Matthew

Thanks,

column1: [UI]UST - AMB - PreFlight Validations - Framerate
column28:
*User Story1:* Validate Framerate Compliance
As a user, I want to upload a file and have the preflight analyze the framerate so that I can quickly determine if the file meets compliance standards.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I have selected a file for registration,
*WHEN* the system performs a preflight analysis on the framerate,
*THEN* if the framerate is valid (23.976, 24, 25, 29.97, or 30fps), a green circle with a green tick mark should be displayed with the message “The framerate has passed.”

*User Story2:* Indicate Non-Compliance with Framerate
As a user, I want to be notified when the framerate of my uploaded file is not compliant so that I can make necessary corrections before submission.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I have uploaded a file,
*WHEN* the system detects that the framerate does not meet compliance,
*THEN* a red circle with a red exclamatory mark should be displayed with the message “The framerate of this asset, %%, does not meet compliance. Accepted framerates are 23.976, 24, 25, 29.97, 30fps.” and the submit button should be greyed out.
*AND* the suggested corrective action message “Please correct and resubmit. Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/cover-art/]” should be shown.

*User Story3:* Indicate Unreadable Framerate
As a user, I want to be informed when the system cannot read the framerate from the file header so that I can take appropriate action to rectify the issue.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I have uploaded a file,
*WHEN* the system cannot read the framerate from the header data,
*THEN* a yellow circle with a yellow exclamatory mark should be displayed with the message “The Value for framerate is not readable from the header data of the submitted file.”
*AND* the suggested corrective action message “It is recommended to re-render the asset(s) to apply the appropriate header data and try again. Alternatively, you can proceed as-is with the possibility that the file could fail secondary validations. Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/cover-art/]” should also be shown.

column1: Create GraphQL query to fetch MBC batch details by batchId
column28:
Description:

Summary:
Develop a paginated backend API endpoint to retrieve details of a specific MBC export batch, identified by batchId. The batch metadata will be returned along with a paginated list of products. 
The response will support UI requirements for displaying product-level and track-level export data on the batch detail page.

column1: [UI] Implement Media Batch Converter Job Status Page
[BE] Implement Media Batch Converter Job Status Page
Implement Media Batch Converter Job Status Page
column28:
'+*Description:*+

We need to implement a new page called Media Batch Converter Job Status Page. This page will display the export status of all batch exports initiated via MBC, whether they were triggered through {*}Product Lookup or Select Files{*}.

The page will follow a List View format and display one row per batch, along with export-related details.

!MBC Batch Export Status page 4.0.png|width=1223,height=702!

*For Product Lookup*

!image-2025-09-12-17-13-31-868.png|width=515,height=270!

*For Select Files*

!image-2025-09-12-17-15-07-270.png|width=533,height=246!

 

*For Product Lookup-based batch exports:*

Each row represents one product within the batch. For example, if Batch ID 1089 includes 4 products, there will be 4 entries (rows) with the same Batch ID but different Product Numbers.

*For Select Files-based batch exports:*

Since there’s no associated Product Number, the Product Number column will show “N/A”.

*The columns displayed in the table are:*
• Batch ID
• Batch Name (with ellipsis-style expandable popup for long names)
• Batch Type
• Username (with info icon to reveal full email)
• Batch Start Date
• Batch End Date
• Destination (with info icon showing workspace and network)
• Priority
• Status (with info icon showing per-track export status for Product Lookup, or per-file status for Select Files)

*Filters available on the page:*
• Username
• Batch ID
• Batch Name
• From Date, To Date
• Status
• Batch Type

+*User Story*+
*As a* user of Media BatchConverter,
*I want*  to view a status page that lists all my export batches,
*So that* I can track the export status of each batch and access detailed information quickly via clickable batch id

 

+*Acceptance Criteria*+

*1. Given* the user has successfully initiated a Batch Export and a pop-up appears containing a clickable Batch ID,
*When* the user clicks the Batch ID link in the pop-up,
*Then* the user is redirected to the Media Batch Converter Job Status Page and the list view loads.

*2. Given* the user has *MBC Status View* Permission only,
*When* the Job Status list loads,
*Then* the list shows only Batch Jobs initiated by that user.

*3. Given* the user has *MBC Status View All* Permission,
*When* the Job Status list loads,
*Then* the list shows all users’ Batch Jobs.

*4. Given* the user lacks both permissions,
*When* the user views the Asset Administration menu,
*Then* the Media Batch Converter Job Status option should not be visible in the menu bar.

5. Username Info Icon Behavior
*Given* a Username is displayed in a row,
*When* the user clicks the Info Icon next to the Username,
*Then* a popup should appear showing the user’s full email address.

6. Destination Info Icon Behavior
*Given* a Destination is displayed in a row,
*When* the user clicks the Info Icon next to the Destination,
*Then* a popup should appear showing the associated Workspace and Network.

*7. Given* the Batch Job Status list is visible,
*When* the user clicks a Batch ID in the first column,
*Then* the user is redirected to the Batch Export Details Page for that Batch ID.

8. Filter Functionality
*Given* the user is on the Media Batch Converter Job Status Page,
*When* the user applies any combination of the available filters (Username, Batch ID, Batch Name, From Date To Date, Status, Batch Type),
*Then* the table should update to display only the batch export entries that match the selected filter criteria.

*9. Given* the user navigated to Batch Export Details Page by clicking a Batch ID that was initiated *via Product Lookup,*
*When* the details page loads,
*Then* it displays the Batch-level information and Product-level statuses for all included Product Numbers.

*10.  Given* the details page is showing Product-level statuses for a *Product Lookup batch,*
*When* the user clicks an Info Icon next to Validation Status (Info Icon only shows up if validation status is Partial/Failed)
*Then* it shows the Track-level statuses for that product.

*11. Given* the user navigated to Batch Export Details Page by clicking a Batch ID that was initiated via *Select Files (local upload/Sony Ci),*
*When* the details page loads,
*Then* it displays the Batch-level information and the uploaded file details.

*12. Given* the user is on the Batch Export Details page and can see the Export ID,
*When* the export initiated by the current user or the user has the *MBC Status View All* Permission,
*Then* the user should be able to click the Export ID and navigate to the corresponding Export Details page.

*13. Given* the user has exported one or more video files through Select Files
*When* the user navigates to the Batch Export Details page and clicks the info icon under Export Type
*Then* the system should display additional video-related metadata

column1: [UI]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - PreFlight Validation - 12" Vinyl Single 78 - Duration
column28:
As a {*}user{*},
I want the system to validate the duration of uploaded WAV assets,
So that I am warned if the audio exceeds the recommended maximum length for vinyl masters, and I can take corrective steps before proceeding.

*Acceptance Criteria*

*Scenario 1: User submits a WAV 16/24b asset with duration ≤ 4 mins 30 secs*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit or 24-bit depth
*And* clicks *Submit*
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the duration
*And* the asset duration is *less than or equal to 4 minutes 30 seconds*
*Then* the asset registration should {*}pass without warning{*}.

*Scenario 2: User submits a WAV 16/24b asset with duration > 4 mins 30 secs*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit or 24-bit depth
*And* clicks *Submit*
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the duration
*And* the asset duration is *greater than 4 minutes 30 seconds*
*Then* the system should still allow registration but display the following {*}warning message{*}:
"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 78 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

 

Component 1 Side A master is xx:xx:xx long

Component 1 Side B master is xx:xx:xx long

 

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch vinyl:
 - @78 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds"

 

Notes From Refinement 9.8:

All good with the AC.

Jack - Need to get sample assets & products for each config - Check with Vitaly he has all the sample assets. 

Add an analysis ticket for both UI & BE for Vinyl validation for preflight.

Can ignore the RPM, Should take the product config in consideration and the message should be generic.

column1: Adjust how asset registration jobs behave for multi tracks
column28:
*Desc:*

Currently UST always updates the registrationJob status to the last action that occurs on a master. For example if you register two tracks back to back and the second one fails the job would be failed despite there being one registered asset. This can lead to confusion with users or also causes issues with how kafka team is processing messaging as they use the jobStatus for certain workflows. As such we have decided revamp how UST interacts with the job status in a couple of manners.

 

*Proposed Changes:*

*Introduce a new partially registration flag for the job status:*

We want to introduce a flag called partially registered to handle cases where we have successfully registered uploads and some manner of failed upload. This will allow UST to keep user's informed that their jobs need to be reviewed and kafka team can treat this as the same as registered successfully since some assets went through.

In order to support this UST would need to make the following changes
 * Whenever a job has a failure we check if there are registered assets tied to the assetSubmission. If there are instead of failing the job we update the job successful and set the partial registration flag 
 * Whenever we clear any failed jobs we need to recheck the job status. If we cleared the last failed upload then the status should be updated to registration successful
 ** Cancel should not be considered a failed status so should not impact status
 * If no assets are registered the job status will behave as is currently is
 * We should do a sanity test of one of these jobs in legacy (mainly export)

 

*Clean up certain UST workflows:*
 * Cancel currently doesn't reset the job status so should be adjust with the above logic
 * Un-registration should also take into consideration the above logic

 

*QA Testing:*
 # Test multi track workflows with these two baselines
 ## One valid register file tied to the master
 ## No registered file tied to the master
 # Single track uploads for sanity
 ## Should also try auto-correct workflow and assetSwap

*QA Notes:*
 * Please note cover behaves a little different then the existing masters which we will try to get more in sync for the future

*Dev Notes:*

We need a future ticket to display this flag on registration job page
Kafka team will need a ticket when this is picked up to make changes on their end.
column435: 25/Jun/25 6:03 PM;spag001;As per discussion with the other teams, we have decided to do this via flag in the assetRegistrationJobs table instead of a new status to lower the amount of changes.;;;

14/Jul/25 6:22 PM;spag001;*Testing 1A - Multi track where there is a registered file tied to the master :*
 # Register a separate track single file in a multi track 
 ## Job status is successful and partial flag is false
 # Register a separate track file that will fail in asset validation in the backend ( easiest way I found was channel count)
 ## Job status is successful and partial flag is true
 ## After clearing out the failed upload job status is still successful and partial flag is false
 # Attempt an upload a file but cancel it
 ## Job status does not change and partial is still false
 # Register two assets that will fail then clear out both one at a time
 ## First clear job status is successful and partial flag is true
 ## Second clear job status is still successful and partial flag is false
 # Asset Swap an asset that will fail
 ## Job status is successful and partial flag is true
 ## Clearing the asset resets flag back to false;;;

 ## Job status is successful and partial flag is false
 # Register an asset that will fail
 ## Job status will be normal failure status (IE Asset Validation Failed) and partial flag is false
 # Cancel an asset upload
 ## Status changes should behave as currently and partial flag is false;;;

Currently UST always updates the registrationJob status to the last action that occurs on a master. For example if you register two tracks back to back and the second one fails the job would be failed despite there being one registered asset. This can lead to confusion with users or also causes issues with how kafka team is processing messaging as they use the jobStatus for certain workflows. As such we have decided revamp how UST interacts with the job status in a couple of manners.

 

*Proposed Changes:*

*Introduce a new partially registration flag for the job status:*

We want to introduce a flag called partially registered to handle cases where we have successfully registered uploads and some manner of failed upload. This will allow UST to keep user's informed that their jobs need to be reviewed and kafka team can treat this as the same as registered successfully since some assets went through.

In order to support this UST would need to make the following changes
 * Whenever a job has a failure we check if there are registered assets tied to the assetSubmission. If there are instead of failing the job we update the job successful and set the partial registration flag 
 * Whenever we clear any failed jobs we need to recheck the job status. If we cleared the last failed upload then the status should be updated to registration successful
 ** Cancel should not be considered a failed status so should not impact status
 * If no assets are registered the job status will behave as is currently is

*Clean up certain UST workflows:*

column1: MBC ISRC Lookup - include only RAAS System Assets
column28:
'+*Description*+

Currently, when using MBC to pull stereo audio assets via ISRC lookup, the system retrieves assets not only from the GRAS system but also from legacy GAS system. This results in duplicate or redundant audio files being returned for a single ISRC.

We need to ensure that ISRC lookups only retrieve assets from GRAS and exclude any results from the GAS system.

+*User Story*+

*As a* MBC user,
*I want* ISRC lookups in MBC to only return assets from GRAS,
*So that* I can avoid duplicate results

+*Acceptance Criteria*+

*Given* a user performs an ISRC lookup in MBC
*When* the system queries for audio assets
*Then* only assets from GRAS should be returned
    *And* no assets from the legacy GAS system should appear in the results

column1: [UI/BE] Download: Full master capability from UST
column28:
*User story:* Adding Download options on UST for a whole master. Nelson's wireframe for details pages is in Attachments.

 

*Pre-conditions:*

User has AOMA3 EXPORT or AOMA3 EXPORT UNAPPROVED MASTER permission

User is on UST

_Exclude Vinyl masters as this is on a different ticket, and implementation may be different:_ AOMA3-2771

*Acceptance Criteria:*

[~hale002]{color:#de350b} *modify the AC's here so that it more accurately represents UST flow. Test cases should also be modified based on what masters are currently supported.*{color}

 

WHEN user has permission AOMA3 EXPORT
AND user has selected a master from Associated Masters section
AND user has execute access on at least one of master's security group
AND master has at least one file available for download ({_}UI to use assetAvailability flag here{_})
THEN display "Download All (.zip)" and "Download Selected (.zip)" buttons in dark gray header, next to master ID, with cloud icon
 * Nelson was thinking that the buttons should be uniform with the single cloud icon, but I'll let UI team determine what they think is better
 * !image-2025-06-09-09-51-31-964.png|width=595,height=78!

 

WHEN master is unapproved
AND user has permission AOMA3 EXPORT UNAPPROVED MASTER
AND user has selected a master from Associated Masters section
AND user has execute access on at least one of master's security group
AND master has at least one file available for download ({_}UI to use assetAvailability flag here{_})
THEN display "Download All (.zip)" and "Download Selected (.zip)" buttons in dark gray header, next to master ID, with cloud icon

 

WHEN user clicks "Download All"
THEN all master's listed files should be downloaded in a single .zip folder
 * *{color:#de350b}User should not need to check any box for this{color}*

 

WHEN user checks any number of folder, or file, or component(s)
AND user clicks "Download Selected"
THEN download selected files in a single .zip folder
 * Is it possible to have logic where clicking any of the download icons and buttons will just download selected files? That way user won't have to scroll for a 100+ track product. See below screenshot and bottom suggestion by Nelson
 * !image-2025-06-09-09-53-07-493.png|width=577,height=293!
 * Button should be grayed out until a file, component or folder is selected
 * In order for this to work for PKGFs, we'll need to add checkboxes on each Component, folder and file in the Associated Masters section. Discuss this

 

Do we keep the modal for Long/Short Name and Reason from single file download (disregard 'i' icons/previews)?
 * +*For UI:*+ The naming options are not applicable for PKGFs, for now...so you can exclude the options on modal when its PKGF. For QAs/Jack, when the test is run here for PKGFs, only the reason entry is expected to show.
 * +*For BE:*+ Should we implement naming convention before the zipping? If so, it should be the same as Export. I suppose since this is Full Master as opposed to track, we should shorten it somewhat. Current Export file-naming scheme is in Attachments as an Excel

!image-2025-03-26-14-33-41-664.png!

 

There will be a single event for a whole master download in Master Event History (in the desc, indicate this is a "full master download")
 * Whether it is a single file or a full master, the event history should have one entry for each asset
 * Event type should be HTTP Download, as previous downloads are
 * Like for LFV and AMB "sub-types", implement the same on PKGF master (has PDFs, labels, docs, zip text docs, etc, all with different master IDs)

 

Single email notification to be sent (track master information needed in the email can be called from the table that PKGF notification email uses. As this is coming from the Associated Masters section, product information should also be there)
 * For full master download email, there is also a certain table in UST which has information; this table can be used in the email to display the tracks

 

*Test cases:*
 # PKGF (One of 2 most important cases, as this will help to reduce A2 DMD traffic)
 # WAV (The other of the 2, to reduce A2 digital Export traffic. Verify file-naming mimics MASTER-centric Export to Ci/DMD/MAF, when long Option chosen)
 # Cover (A 3rd most important case, to reduce A2 digital Export traffic. Verify file-naming mimics MASTER-centric Export to Ci/DMD/MAF, when long Option chosen)
 # Atmos
 # SFV (verify file-naming mimics MASTER-centric Export to Ci/DMD/MAF, when long Option chosen)
 # VSC (verify file-naming mimics MASTER-centric Export to Ci/DMD/MAF, when long Option chosen)
 # Regression test: single download

column1: [UI/BE] Remove hard-coding of CTs
column28:
_*User story:*_ We should remove all hard-coding for CTs in AOMA accordingly; these are now being called from a proper table. AOMA 3/AMSE 2 is making changes in linked ticket on their end, but AMSE 1 should do the same on their end too.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

AMSE 1 to stop hardcoding of CTs anywhere in UST and AOMA 2, and call from the appropriate DB table instead

column1: Pre-Flight Cover support: Allow only correct formats
column28:
*User story:* Only 4 formats are allowed for Covers. This should be checked as part of the pre-flight process for Cover registrations

*Acceptance Criteria:*

WHEN uploaded/selected image for Cover registration is not of format:
 * jpg
 * jpeg
 * tif
 * tiff

THEN prevent/block the registration job from starting
AND display message that says "Selected image format does not adhere to Cover registration guidelines; .jpg, .jpeg, .tif and .tiff are accepted file formats"

Do not show filepath when uploading; filename should show instead (for all master types)

*Extra use case:*
 # _Manually change a disallowed format (like a png) to jpeg and try to upload; this should fail_

column1: SFV Descriptor File Fix  Differences Tab Display
column28:
*Business Value:* As the user I would like to see the Differences tab of the Descriptor File display only the categories and data which can be used to see the "Source" and "Autocorrect" comparisons

{*}Description{*}: With the newest build we are seeing all the categories within the descriptor file display in the Differences tab, and we'd only like to see the categories in which we have a comparison between the Source and the Autocorrect

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Given the user is looking at the SFV Descriptor File from the UST

When they are on the "Differences" tab of the file

Then all data that compares the Source and the Autocorrected information for the asset will display

And all the criteria that do not have both Source and Autocorrected information for will not display on the differences tab

And the name of the category for all Categories (the header, as shown in yellow) will show even when none of its criteria has a comparison available

And the Category will be expandable/collapsible when there are criteria data available for it

And the Category will not be expandable when there is no criteria data available for it

!image-2024-04-02-17-04-36-329.png!

column1: Standardize Download Icons

When there is a clickable icon that starts the download(s) process 

Then the button will be as shown in the image below:

And this button will be available for the asset types AOMA currently allows downloads for the following:
 * Dolby Atmos

 * Surround 5.1 
 * Surround 7.1 
 * WAV 16 Bit

And this will be the button used for future download options on asset types that aren't yet downloadable)

column1: UST - Support For Packaging Graphics
UST Registration Endpoints for bulk registration/system integrations
column28:
Quick Notes from 5/23/2023 Meeting:
 * AMP has a way of receiving assets for registrations. They also support metadata with json key-value pair.
 * Once AMP receives a registration request, they create amp-asset-key and using UST graphQL endpoints, submit asset for UST registration
 * To add SMEJ SFV UST registration support, we need to define all QC metadata and Jira ticket creation details via key value pair XML. and then UST graphQL should support accepting that metadata along with asset for registration.
 * We also need to support productized registration as currently, AMP supports master only registration.

column1: [BE]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - Secondary Validation -7" Vinyl Single7" Vinyl EP 33 1/37" Vinyl Extended Play 45 - Duration
column28:
*User Story:*
As a user uploading or reviewing a vinyl master,
I want to be warned if a side of a 7-inch vinyl exceeds recommended time limits for its speed (RPM),
So that I can proactively contact the cutting facility or make changes before finalizing the master.

*Acceptance Criteria* 

*AC1 - Warn When Side Length Exceeds Limit for 7” @ 45 RPM*
*Given* a user registers a master for a 7-inch vinyl
*And* the selected speed is 45 RPM
*And* a side length exceeds 4 minutes 30 seconds
*Then* the system displays a warning:
"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 7 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

 

Component 1 Side A master is xx:xx:xx long

Component 1 Side B master is xx:xx:xx long

 

Recommended side lengths for 10 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds

 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes "

 

*AC2 - Warn When Side Length Exceeds Limit for 7” @ 33 1/3 RPM*
*Given* a user registers a master for a 7-inch vinyl
*And* the selected speed is 33 1/3 RPM
*And* a side length exceeds 7 minutes
*Then* the system displays a warning:
"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 7 inch vinyl master at 33 1/3 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

 

Component 1 Side A master is xx:xx:xx long

Component 1 Side B master is xx:xx:xx long

 

Recommended side lengths for 10 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds

 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes "

*AC3 - Do Not Show Warning When Within Limits*
*Given* a user registers a master for a 7-inch vinyl
*And* the selected speed is 45 RPM
*And* each side is ≤ 4 minutes 30 seconds
*Or* the selected speed is 33 1/3 RPM
*And* each side is ≤ 7 minutes
*Then* no warning is displayed

*AC4 - Side-Specific Warning*
*Given* only one side (e.g. Side A) exceeds the limit
*Then* the warning only references that specific side (e.g. “Side A”)
*And* does not reference other sides that are within limits

column1: [BE]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - Secondary Validation - 10" Vinyl Extended Play 10" Vinyl Single 10" Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3 - Duration
column28:
As a user,I want to validate the duration of 10" vinyl master files based on their RPM and format,
So that users are warned when their submissions exceed the recommended limits, allowing for better planning and manufacturing accuracy.

Applicable Formats (Triggers Validation)

10" Vinyl Extended Play

10" Vinyl Single

10" Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*AC1 – Accept Valid Duration for 45 RPM (≤ 9 min)*
*Given* a user uploads a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit),
*And* the RPM is 45,
*And* the duration of a side is ≤ 9 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation without warning.

*AC2 – Pass with Warning for 45 RPM (> 9 min)*
*Given* a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit) with RPM = 45,
*And* the duration of a side > 9 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation,
*And* return the following warning message:
"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 10 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

 

Component 1 Side A master is xx:xx:xx long

Component 1 Side B master is xx:xx:xx long

 

Recommended side lengths for 10 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 9 minutes

 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 12 minutes "

*AC3 – Accept Valid Duration for 33 1/3 RPM (≤ 12 min)*
*Given* a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit) with RPM = 33 1/3,
*And* the duration of a side ≤ 12 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation without warning.

*AC4 – Pass with Warning for 33 1/3 RPM (> 12 min)*
*Given* a 10" vinyl master (16-bit or 24-bit) with RPM = 33 1/3,
*And* the duration of a side > 12 minutes,
*Then* the system must pass the validation,
*And* return the following warning message (same as 45 RPM case):

"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 10 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

 

Component 1 Side A master is xx:xx:xx long

Component 1 Side B master is xx:xx:xx long

 

Recommended side lengths for 10 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 9 minutes

 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 12 minutes "

 

AC5 – Ignore Other Formats
Given a vinyl master that is not one of the following:
10" Vinyl Extended Play
10" Vinyl Single
10" Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3
Then this validation must not be triggered.
Would you like a version of this in Gherkin format or a Jira ticket template?  

 

Notes for user story:
Applicable Formats (Trigger Validation):

10" Vinyl Extended Play

10" Vinyl Single

10" Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3

Validation Logic:

RPM      Recommended Max Duration      Behavior If Within Limit      Behavior If Exceeds Limit
45                   9 minutes                                       Pass                              Pass with Warning
33 1/3            12 minutes                                     Pass                              Pass with Warning

Warning Message (for both cases exceeding recommended duration):

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 10 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended. 
Recommended side lengths for 10 inch vinyl: 
 - @45 rpm up to 9 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 12 minutes

column1: [BE]UST - Vinyl 16 & 24b - Secondary Validation - 12" Vinyl Single 78 - Duration
column28:
As a {*}user{*},
I want the system to validate the duration of uploaded WAV assets,
So that I am warned if the audio exceeds the recommended maximum length for vinyl masters, and I can take corrective steps before proceeding.

*Acceptance Criteria*

*Scenario 1: User submits a WAV 16/24b asset with duration ≤ 4 mins 30 secs*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit or 24-bit depth
*And* clicks *Submit*
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the duration
*And* the asset duration is *less than or equal to 4 minutes 30 seconds*
*Then* the asset registration should {*}pass without warning{*}.

*Scenario 2: User submits a WAV 16/24b asset with duration > 4 mins 30 secs*
*Given* the user uploads a WAV asset with 16-bit or 24-bit depth
*And* clicks *Submit*
*When* the BE secondary validation checks the duration
*And* the asset duration is *greater than 4 minutes 30 seconds*
*Then* the system should still allow registration but display the following {*}warning message{*}:

"Warning: This following side(s) exceed(s) the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 78 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

 

Component 1 Side A master is xx:xx:xx long

Component 1 Side B master is xx:xx:xx long

 

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch vinyl:
 - @78 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds"

column1: UST SFV UI bug - minmizing import from Ci modal opens registration modal
column28:
If a user attempts to do an upload from Ci, and searches for something that doesn't return any results, THEN closes the "Import from Sony Ci...." modal THAN the SFV registration modal is opening:

 

!image-2025-09-05-12-29-33-221.png!

 

Modal is showing this message in the pre-flight section:

Pre-Flight Analysis Failed (Variable 'sonyCiAssetKey' has an invalid value: Variable 'sonyCiAssetKey' has coerced Null value for NonNull type 'String!')

 

In the case of closing the CI import modal, the registration modal should not be opening since nothing was selected.

column1: Select file button displays for stereo audio tracks submitted for registration
column28:
Issue is currently in all enviroments.

When a user does stereo audio track level registration, and submits an upload using TusD or Aspera, the select file button continues to display despite track level registration in progress.
Please note in the below screenshot that reg is in progress for tracks 1 - 3, but the select file button is displaying for tracks 2 and 3.
!image-2025-09-04-08-31-04-546.png|width=548,height=86!
IF user expands a track in progress, then the select file button stops displaying. That's the case for track 1 in this example.

Expected behavior - select file button does not display while upload/registration is in progress when submitted via track level upload.

column1: [BE]Analysis - UST - Cover Registration: Re-save JPEG for Undefined Units error(Only DPI/PPI)
column28:
As cover art is registered we often find errors with assets. 
 * DPI/PPI

We would like to explore and build workflows to auto-correct these issues to be implemented into the AOMA registration workflow. 

User submits asset, asset fails validation, user has an option to select auto-correct for the system to attempt to correct the issue. - AOMA needs to come up with a solution for this

Note: we also need to cover the use case where no header data is available in this scenario we need to auto correct as well, We need to explore this option using the Tiffany tool which Matt.C had developed if there are any other approach please update it here.

Also this is dependent on the imagemagick version upgrade.

 

Use Cases1:

Ensure "Select Audio Sources" in MBC Exports the Highest-Priority Format When No/All/multiple Selection is Made
column28:
'+*Description:*+
In the Media Batch Converter (MBC) tool, when exporting audio products, there is a section called "Select Audio Sources" that has multiple format options, including:
• WAV 24bit Track Master 192kHz
• WAV 24bit Track Master 176.4kHz
• WAV 24bit Track Master 96kHz
• WAV 24bit Track Master 88.2kHz
• WAV 24bit Track Master 48kHz
• WAV 24bit Track Master 44.1kHz
• WAV 16bit Track Master
• DDP Track Master

If the user does not make any selection in this section or selects all, the export behavior should be the same logic. That is, *the system should automatically look into the product and determine which of the above formats are available for each track.*

{*}The system should then export one format per track, following a strict priority order from highest to lowest{*}. For example, if both "WAV 16bit TrackMaster" and "DDP TrackMaster" are available for the same track, the system should choose the higher-priority "WAV 16bit TrackMaster."

This ticket ensures that default ( full-selection ) behavior in "Select Audio Sources" always results in the highest available audio format being exported per track, based on the priority order above.

!image-2025-07-24-10-11-44-295.png|width=521,height=225!

+*User Story:*+
*As a* user exporting audio products in MBC,
*I want* the system to automatically select and export the highest-priority available audio format per track when no audio source is selected or when all are selected or when multiple audio sources are selected,
*So that* I get the best available format of each track

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
*1. Given* a user does *not select any* options under "Select Audio Sources,"
*When* they export an audio product,
*Then* the system should export the highest-priority available format per track from the defined list.
*2. Given* a user *selects all options* under "Select Audio Sources,"
*When* they export an audio product,
*Then* the behavior should be identical to making no selection, the system should still export the highest-priority available format per track.

*3. Given* a user *selects multiple (not all)* *options* under "Select Audio Sources,"

*When* they export an audio product,
*Then* the system should still export the *highest-priority available format* per track.
*4. Given* a product contains multiple available formats for the same track (e.g. both WAV 16bit Track Master and DDP Track Master),
*When* the export is triggered with either no selection or multiple selected,
*Then* only the highest-priority format should be exported for that track (e.g. WAV 16bit instead of DDP).

column1: SFV Validation Bug with Null Values
column28:
*Desc:*

Due to how the way .contains works, if a value is null it can not be used to compare into an unmutable list. We should update the places we are doing this in the SFV validations to handle this correctly.

 

*Dev Notes:*

Example from the DPSA is validateFormatProfile function in assetValidationService. The below code will fail if attributeValue is null. We should verify other places don't also have this issue.

{color:#000000}{color:#000000}{color:#000000}{color:#0000c0}SFV_SUPPORTED_FORMAT_PROFILES{color}{color:#000000}.contains({color}{color:#6a3e3e}attributeValue{color}{color:#000000}){color}{color}{color}{color}
column435: 27/Aug/25 8:32 PM;spag001;Fix was low risk so we pushed it last nights build.;;;

column1: Fix for MBC Submit Button Incorrectly Disabled After Closing “Select Destinations” Without Changes
column28:
'+*Description:*+
There is currently a bug in the MBC. After a user selects files to export via the *“Select Files”* section and then proceeds to the *“Select Destinations”* section:
1. If the user fills in all mandatory fields with valid input and clicks “Apply”, the Submit button becomes enabled — this is correct.
2. However, if the user does not click Submit at this point and instead *reopens the “Select Destinations” section* just to review the entered information *(without making any changes),* and then closes the section by *clicking the “X” (close icon)* rather than clicking Apply, the Submit button becomes disabled.
3. This is incorrect behavior. The Submit button should remain enabled as long as:
• Valid destination info has already been saved.
• The user has not cleared or invalidated any mandatory inputs.

!image-2025-07-21-15-05-31-438.png|width=726,height=403!

+*User Story:*+
*As a* user of MBC,
*I want* the Submit button to remain enabled after I review and close the Select Destinations section without making changes,
*So that* I don’t have to re-apply already valid input in order to proceed with the export.

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
*1. Given* the user has selected files and filled in all mandatory fields in the Select Destinations section with valid inputs,
*When* they click Apply,
*Then* the Submit button should be enabled.
*2. Given* the Submit button is enabled after clicking Apply,
*When* the user reopens the Select Destinations section without making any changes,
       *And* then closes it using the “X” (close icon),
*Then* the Submit button should remain enabled.
*3. Given* the Select Destinations information is valid and has been saved,
*When* the user chooses to close the section using the “X” without re-applying,
*Then* the system should not disable the Submit button.

column1: Redirect to Media Batch Converter with Pre-Populated Products from Mobile Audio Manager
column28:
'+*Description:*+

When users are on the *Mobile Audio Manager* page and select one or more products, clicking the *Media Batch Converter button* should redirect them to the *Media Batch Converter* page.

Upon arrival at the Media Batch Converter, all previously selected products should already be {*}pre-populated in the search input box and automatically looked up{*}. The product details should be displayed below without requiring the user to manually search again.

The "Media Batch Converter" button on the Mobile Audio Manager page is now controlled by a permission: *MEDIA_BATCH_CONVERT.*
Only users who have this permission assigned will be able to see and access the Media Batch Converter button and its functionality.
If a user does not have this permission, the button will be hidden from the UI entirely.

!Mobile audio manager to MBC 2.0.png|width=722,height=333!

+*User Story:*+

*As a* user on the Mobile Audio Manager page,
*I want* to be redirected to the Media Batch Converter with my selected products pre-filled and looked up,
*So that* I can proceed with my export seamlessly without having to re-enter product information.

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
*1. Given* the user is on the Mobile Audio Manager page and has selected one or more products,
*When* they click the Media Batch Converter button,
*Then* they should be redirected to the Media Batch Converter page.

*2. Given* the user is redirected to the Media Batch Converter page with selected products,
*When* the page loads,
*Then* the selected product numbers should be pre-populated in the search box.

*3. Given* the selected product numbers are pre-populated,
*When* the Media Batch Converter page loads,
*Then* those products should already be looked up and their details should be displayed automatically.

*4. Given* the user exports mobile products using the Media Batch Converter ,
*When* the export process is completed,
*Then* the exported output should match exactly with the output generated when exporting the same mobile products via the existing Batch Offering

 *5.Given* a user has the MEDIA_BATCH_CONVERT permission assigned,
*When* the user navigates to the Mobile Audio Manager page,
*Then* the Media Batch Converter button should be visible.

*6. Given* a user has the MEDIA_BATCH_CONVERT permission assigned,
*When* the user clicks the Media Batch Converter button,
*Then* they should be able to proceed with Media Batch Converter.

*7.Given* a user does not have the MEDIA_BATCH_CONVERT permission assigned,
*When* the user navigates to the Mobile Audio Manager page,
*Then* the Media Batch Converter button should not be visible.

column28:
'+*User Story*+
*As a* user of the Asset Upload Job Status Page,
*I want* the Type, Status, and Asset Upload # filters to function properly,
*so that* I can accurately filter and view only the relevant asset upload jobs.

+*Acceptance Criteria*+
*1. Given* the user is on the Asset Upload Job Status Page,
*When* the user selects a value from the Type filter,
*Then* only the asset upload jobs matching the selected type should be displayed.


*2. Given* the user is on the Asset Upload Job Status Page,
*When* the user selects a value from the Status filter,
*Then* only the asset upload jobs matching the selected status should be displayed.


*3. Given* the user is on the Asset Upload Job Status Page,
*When* the user enters an Asset Upload # in the corresponding filter,
*Then* only the asset upload job matching that ID should be displayed.

column1: Fix column sorting not working on Asset Upload Job Status page + Not display Archive upload records
column28:
'+*Description:*+
On the Asset Upload Job Status page, many column sorting are currently not working as expected. Users are unable to sort data correctly by clicking on certain column headers. This ticket is to address and fix the sorting functionality, ensuring that all sortable columns allow users to sort the data in ascending and descending order properly.

!image-2025-07-23-12-42-54-349.png|width=557,height=179!

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
*1. Given* the user is on the Asset Upload Job Status page,
*When* they click on any column header that is expected to support sorting,
*Then* the data should be sorted in ascending order on the first click and descending order on the second click and return to original display order on the third click.

*2. Given* the user is loading the Asset Upload Job Status page,
*When* the system retrieves and displays upload records,
*Then* only Commercial Site upload records should be shown,
        *And* Archive upload records should not appear on this page.

*Then* only Commercial Site upload records should be shown,
        *And* Archive upload records should not appear on this page.

*==> CONFIRMED!*;;;

column1: [UI]UST - DBKS - Dimension value should be in inches and not in pixel
column28:
*User Story 1:* Display Dimension in Inches
As a user, I want the Dimension value to be displayed in inches when I open the dbks product, so that I can easily understand the size of the assets in a familiar unit of measure.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user opens a dbks product with registered assets,
*WHEN* the asset has a populated Dimension value,
*THEN* the Dimension value must be displayed in inches and not in pixels.

 

*User Story 2:* Rename Header Text
As a user, I want to see the header “Dimension ” renamed to “Dimension (Inches)” when I view the asset, so that it is clear that the value shown is in inches.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user opens a dbks product with registered assets,
*WHEN* the asset’s Dimension header is displayed,
*THEN* the header must be labeled as “Dimension(Inches)” instead of “Dimension .”

column1: [BE]UST - DBKS - Dimension value should be in inches and not in pixel
column28:
*User Story 1:* Validate Asset Registration and Dimension Format
As a user of the dbks product,
I want to ensure that when I open a DBKS product, it displays the Dimension value in inches,
So that I can be sure I am seeing the correct measurement format.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* an asset is registered in the dbks product and has a Dimension value,
*WHEN* I open the asset,
*THEN* the Dimension value should display in inches and not in pixels.

*User Story 2:* Ensure Dimension is Not Populated in Pixels
As a user of the dbks product,
I want to ensure that if the Dimension value is present, it should never be in pixels,
So that there is no confusion regarding the measurement unit.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* an asset is registered in the dbks product,
*WHEN* I open the asset,
*THEN* if a Dimension value exists, it must show only in inches with no indication of pixels.

column1: [UI]UST - SFV - Download for Source Master & Autocorrected using http download
column28:
*User Story 1* – Export Button Availability
As a registered user I want to see the Export button only when an asset has gone through the auto-correct option, So that I can download the corrected asset

*Acceptance Criteria*
*Scenario 1:* Asset with auto-correct applied
*Given* the user opens a music video product
*And* the registered asset has gone through the auto-correct option
*When* the user views the screen
*Then* the Export button should be visible

*Scenario 2:* Asset without auto-correct applied
*Given* the user opens a music video product
*And* the registered asset has not gone through the auto-correct option
*When* the user views the screen
*Then* the Export button should not be visible

*User Story 2* – Export Window Workflow for Auto-Corrected Assets
As a registered user I want to open an export pop-up and download my chosen master's, So that I can export assets using the correct delivery method

*Acceptance Criteria*
*Scenario 1:* Opening export pop-up
*Given* the Export button is visible
*When* the user clicks on the Export button
*Then* a pop-up window should open

*Scenario 2:* Viewing export options
*Given* the export pop-up is open
*When* the user selects the download drop-down
*Then* the user should see:
A list of all available Master IDs (e.g., 123456 – Short Form Video Master)
A check box option labeled:
Source Master (Master ID – Master Name)
e.g., Source Master (123456 – Short Form Video Master)

*Scenario 3:* Enabling submit
*Given* the user has not selected any check box
*When* the user views the Submit for Export button
*Then* the button should be disabled
*Given* the user checks the Source Master check box
*When* the user views the Submit for Export button
*Then* the button should be enabled

*Scenario 4:* Submitting for export
*Given* the Submit for Export button is enabled
*When* the user clicks on it
*Then* the system should initiate a download via Aspera

*User Story 3* – Download for Non-Auto-Corrected Assets
As a registered user, I want to download assets without export via Aspera if auto-correct has not been applied, So that I can still access the file via HTTPS

*Acceptance Criteria*
*Scenario 1:* Download options without export
*Given* the user opens a music video product
*And* the registered asset did not go through the auto-correct option
*When* the user clicks on the Download icon(cloud button with downards facing arrow)
*Then* the user should only see the HTTPS download option

*Scenario 2:* HTTPS download action
*Given* the HTTPS option is visible
*When* the user clicks on it
*Then* the system should initiate the download via HTTPS

column1: [UI]UST - AMB - PreFlight Validations - Audio Stream
column28:
*User Story 1:* Preflight Analysis Trigger
As a user,I want to trigger a preflight analysis when I select a file for registration,
So that the system can analyze the file for the Audio Stream compliance requirements.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user selects a file for registration,
*WHEN* the file is selected,
*THEN* the system initiates a preflight analysis for the Audio Stream immediately.

 

*User Story 2:* Successful Compliance Notification
As a user,I want to see a visual confirmation when the audio stream compliance is successful,
So that I know I can proceed to registration.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the uploaded asset contains no audio stream data,
*WHEN* the preflight analysis is completed,
*THEN* a green circle with a green tick mark is displayed,
*AND* it mentions “Audio Stream has passed.”

 

*User Story 3:* Failure Notification
As a user,I want to be alerted when my uploaded asset contains audio streams that do not meet compliance,So that I understand what the issue is and how to correct it.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the uploaded asset contains audio stream data,
*WHEN* the preflight analysis is completed,
*THEN* a red circle with a red exclamatory mark is displayed,
*AND* a message reads, “The selected asset contains audio stream data. This is not allowed.”
*AND* the suggested corrective action message reads, “Please re-render without audio channel data and resubmit.”

 

*User Story 4:* Submit Button State Update
As a user,I want to see the submit button disabled when my asset does not meet audio stream criteria,So that I cannot submit an invalid asset for registration.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the uploaded asset contains audio stream data,
*WHEN* the preflight analysis is completed,
*THEN* the submit button is greyed out and not clickable.

 

*User Story 5:* Compliance Guidelines Access
As a user,I want to access compliance guidelines easily,
So that I can ensure my asset meets the registration requirements.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user encounters a validation message,
*WHEN* the user views the message,
*THEN* a link to the compliance guidelines (“[https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/cover-art/]”) is clearly visible and clickable.

column1: [UI]UST - AMB - PreFlight Validations - File Extension
column28:
*User Story 1:* Validate File Extension
As a user, I want the system to validate the file extension of the asset I upload, so that I can ensure it is in the correct format before submitting.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user selects a file for registration on the system,
*WHEN* the file is analyzed,
*THEN* if the file has a .mov extension, a green circle with a green tick mark should be displayed, and the message “File Extension has passed” should be shown.

 

*User Story 2:* Show Validation Error for Incorrect File Extension
As a user, I want to be informed if my uploaded asset does not meet the required file extension so that I can take corrective action.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user selects a file for registration on the system,
*WHEN* the file is analyzed,
*THEN* if the file does not have a .mov extension, the submit button should be greyed out, a red circle with a red exclamatory mark should appear, and the following validation message must be displayed: “The extension of this asset must be .mov (quicktime wrapper).”
*AND* the suggested corrective action message must be: "Please re-render and resubmit a corrected source. Compliance guidelines can be found here: https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/cover-art/."

 

*User Story 3:* Ensure Submit Button State
As a user, I want to see the submit button state change based on file validation, so that I can understand whether I can proceed with the submission.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user selects a file that passes the file extension check,
*WHEN* the validation is successful,
*THEN* the submit button must be enabled.
*AND* when the user selects a file with an incorrect extension, the submit button must be disabled (greyed out).

column1: [UI]UST - AMB - PreFlight Validations - Codec/Wrapper
column28:
*User Story 1:* Preflight Analysis for Codec/Wrapper Compliance
As a user,I want to have my uploaded file analyzed for Codec/Wrapper compliance,
So that I know if it meets the necessary requirements before submission.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads a file,
*WHEN* the file is analyzed,
*THEN* if the Codec/Wrapper is either ProRes 422, 422(HQ), 422(LT), ProRes 4444, or 4444 XQ, a green circle with a checkmark appears, and the message “Codec/Wrapper has passed” is displayed.

 

*User Story 2:* Indication of Non-compliant Codec/Wrapper
As a user,I want to see an indication when my file’s Codec/Wrapper is non-compliant,
So that I can correct the file before submission.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads a file,
*WHEN* the file does not meet Codec/Wrapper compliance,
*THEN* a red circle with an exclamatory mark appears, the message “The codec of this asset, %% , does not meet compliance. Codec must be one of the following: ProRes 422, 422(HQ), 422(LT) or ProRes 4444, 4444 XQ.” is displayed,
*AND* the submit button is greyed out.

 

{*}User Story 3{*}: Display of Suggested Corrective Actions for Non-compliance
As a user,I want to receive corrective action messages when my file is non-compliant,
So that I know how to fix the issue.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads a file with a non-compliant Codec/Wrapper,
*WHEN* the file analysis is done,
*THEN* the message “To avoid this failure please submit a compliant video source. You may proceed as-is and Media Production will review and advise” is displayed along with the previous error message.

 

*User Story 4:* Indication for Unreadable Codec/Wrapper
As a user,I want to see an indication when the system cannot read the Codec/Wrapper from the asset,So that I can take appropriate actions to resolve the issue.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads a file,
*WHEN* the system cannot read the Codec/Wrapper from the header data,
*THEN* a yellow circle with a yellow exclamatory mark appears and the message “The codec value is not readable from the header data of the submitted file.” is shown.

 

*User Story 5:* Display of Suggested Actions for Unreadable Codec/Wrapper

As a user,I want to receive corrective action messages when the Codec/Wrapper is unreadable,
So that I may attempt to rectify the format of my file.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads a file with unreadable Codec/Wrapper,
*WHEN* the system provides the warning,
*THEN* the message “It is recommended to re-render the asset(s) to apply the appropriate header data and try again. Alternatively, you can proceed as-is with the possibility that the file could fail secondary validations.” is displayed along with the previous error message.
