column1: [UI]UST - AMB - PreFlight Validations - Resolution/Dimension
column28:
*User Story 1:* Validate Resolution for 1x1 Asset
As a user,I want the system to verify if the uploaded asset has the resolution of 3840x3840,
So that I am informed if the asset meets the compliance requirements.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads an asset intended for 1x1,
*WHEN* the system analyzes the asset,
*THEN* if the asset resolution is 3840x3840,
*THEN* a green circle with a green tick mark is displayed, and the message “The Resolution/Dimension has passed” is shown.

 


*User Story 2:* Validate Resolution for 3x4 Asset
As a user,I want the system to verify if the uploaded asset has the resolution of 2048x2732,
So that I am informed if the asset meets the compliance requirements.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads an asset intended for 3x4,
*WHEN* the system analyzes the asset,
*THEN* if the asset resolution is 2048x2732,
*THEN* a green circle with a green tick mark is displayed, and the message “The Resolution/Dimension has passed” is shown.

 

*User Story 3:* Display Error for Non-compliant 1x1 Asset
As a user,I want to be informed when my uploaded 1x1 asset does not meet the resolution criteria,So that I can make necessary corrections to my asset.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads an asset intended for 1x1,
*WHEN* the system analyzes the asset,
*THEN* if the asset resolution does not meet 3840x3840,
*THEN* a red circle with a red exclamation mark is displayed,
*AND* the message “The resolution of this asset, %%, does not meet compliance. The height and width of the submitted video asset must be 3840x3840.” is shown,
*AND* the submit button is greyed out,
*AND* the message “Please correct and resubmit.” is included.

 

*User Story 4:* Display Error for Non-compliant 3x4 Asset
As a user,I want to be informed when my uploaded 3x4 asset does not meet the resolution criteria,So that I can make necessary corrections to my asset.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads an asset intended for 3x4,
*WHEN* the system analyzes the asset,
*THEN* if the asset resolution does not meet 2048x2732,
*THEN* a red circle with a red exclamation mark is displayed,
*AND* the message “The resolution of this asset, %%, does not meet compliance. The height and width of the submitted video asset must be 2048x2732.” is shown,
*AND* the submit button is greyed out,
*AND* the message “Please correct and resubmit.” is included.

 

*User Story 5:* Handle Resolution/Dimension Readability Issue
As a user,I want to be notified when the system cannot read the resolution data from my asset,
So that I can take appropriate action.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user uploads an asset,
*WHEN* the system attempts to read the resolution data and if nothing is returned,
*THEN* a yellow circle with a yellow exclamation mark is displayed,
*AND* the message “Preflight is unable to read resolution data present on this asset.” is shown,
*AND* the suggested corrective action message “It is recommended to re-render the asset(s) to apply the appropriate header data and try again. Alternatively, you can proceed as-is with the possibility that the file could fail secondary validations” is included.

column1: [UI]UST - AMB - PreFlight Validations - Duration
column28:
*User Story 1:* Preflight Duration Check
As a user, I want UST to perform a preflight check on the duration of the uploaded AMB asset so that I can be informed if my asset meets the duration requirements.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* an AMB asset is uploaded,
*WHEN* the system performs a preflight check,
*THEN* if the duration is between 8 seconds and 20 seconds, the upload process continues without issues.

*User Story 2:* Hard Fail for Duration Out of Range
As a user, I want to be notified when the duration of my asset is out of range so that I can correct it before resubmitting.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* an AMB asset is uploaded,
*WHEN* the system checks the duration and it is less than 8 seconds or greater than 20 seconds,
*THEN* the system displays a red exclamatory icon,
*AND* shows the message: “The duration for the submitted Album Motion asset must be from 8 seconds to 20 seconds, the asset submitted duration ss:ff (seconds:frames) does not meet these requirements.”
*AND* shows the validation suggested corrective action message: “Please correct the issue and resubmit.”

*User Story 3:* Provide Compliance Guidelines
As a user, I want to have access to compliance guidelines so that I can ensure my asset adheres to the required standards.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user sees the validation messages for wrong asset duration,
*WHEN* they look for assistance,
*THEN* the guidelines link: “Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/cover-art/]” should be visible

 

*NOTE:* This is for both 1x1 & 3x4

*User Story 1:* Preflight Duration Check
As a user, I want UST to perform a preflight check on the duration of the uploaded AMB asset so that I can be informed if my asset meets the duration requirements.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* an AMB asset is uploaded,
*WHEN* the system performs a preflight check,
*THEN* if the duration is between 8 seconds and 20 seconds, the upload process continues without issues.

*User Story 2:* Hard Fail for Duration Out of Range
As a user, I want to be notified when the duration of my asset is out of range so that I can correct it before resubmitting.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* an AMB asset is uploaded,
*WHEN* the system checks the duration and it is less than 8 seconds or greater than 20 seconds,
*THEN* the system displays a red exclamatory icon,
*AND* shows the message: “The duration for the submitted Album Motion asset must be from 8 seconds to 20 seconds, the asset submitted duration ss:ff (seconds:frames) does not meet these requirements.”
*AND* shows the validation suggested corrective action message: “Please correct the issue and resubmit.”

*User Story 3:* Provide Compliance Guidelines
As a user, I want to have access to compliance guidelines so that I can ensure my asset adheres to the required standards.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a user sees the validation messages for wrong asset duration,
*WHEN* they look for assistance,
*THEN* the guidelines link: “Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/cover-art/]” should be visible

 

*NOTE:* This is for both 1x1 & 3x4 ;;;

column1: Asset RegistrationJob Deadlock Issue
column28:
*Desc:*

We sometimes have been hitting an issue when registering wavs in bulk (folder upload) where the jobs finish too close together and we hit a deadlock issue. We are thinking about moving the job update logic to the event based email polling logic where the different tracks meet back up to avoid this type of issue.

 

*AC:*

For multi track (DSD, wav, immersives) based upload workflows the successful registration status will be updated to complete at the same time the email registration is sent out.

 

*QA Notes:*

Failures will still update the job status immediately but successful registrations will wait for them all to finish.

Please also test un-registration with the workflows. Unregister the last asset tied to a master and mess around with it.

column1: [UI]UST - All Master Type - Message on asset swap & New registration for Full published, post-release products, include warning
column28:
*User Story:1*

As a {*}user{*},
I want to receive a warning message when I attempt an asset swap on a fully published product with a past GRPS release date,
So that I am aware that the new asset will be automatically registered and delivered to partners.

*Acceptance Criteria*

*Scenario 1: Fully published product with past GRPS release date*
 *Given* a product has a publish status of _Fully Published_
 *And* the GRPS release date is a past date
 *When* the user attempts an asset swap
 *Then* a warning pop-up should appear with the message:
_“This action will register the new asset to a released & full published product and will be delivered to the partners automatically.”_

*Scenario 2: Fully published product with past GRPS release date linked to another product*
 *Given* a product (Product A) has a publish status of _Fully Published_
 *And* the GRPS release date is a past date
 *And* Product A is linked to Product B
 *When* the user attempts an asset swap on Product A
 *Then* a warning pop-up should appear with the message:
_“This action will register the new asset to a released & full published product and will be delivered to the partners automatically.”_

*Scenario 3: Both linked products fully published with past GRPS release date*
*Given* a product (Product A) has a publish status of _Fully Published_
*And* the GRPS release date is a past date
*And* Product A is linked to Product B
*And* Product B is also _Fully Published_
*When* the user attempts an asset swap on Product A
*Then* a warning pop-up should appear with the message:
_“This action will register the new asset to a released & full published product and will be delivered to the partners automatically.”_

 

*Note:*

Please refer to Full "Publish Warning Message" spreadsheet attached to this ticket for usecases.

 

 

*Notes from refinement call on 6/17/2025:*

Have a call with EOM so we can decide on the warning's and can decide if its only release date or publish status

 

Linking validations - Check recording for the list of things to do.
h4. *Action Items from 6/17:*
 * *Warning Message Consistency:* Invite Rithwik to the call to ensure consistency in warning messages across both sides(Linking & Reg.).

 * *Warning Message Implementation:* Discuss and finalize the rules for warning messages with the EOM team, including whether to check the release date, published status, or both. (Mohammed)

 * *QC Notes Validation:* Discuss internally and with Mike the validation rules for QC notes, especially for linking and registration of assets to published products. (Rohit did this on the same call)

 * *Immersive Asset Linking:* Discuss and decide on the handling of immersive asset linking, including the consideration of QC notes lock and immersive release date. (Rohit, Mohammed)

 * *Follow-up Meeting:* Schedule another meeting to specifically discuss the immersive registration to stereo product project. (Mohammed)

 * *Follow-up Meeting:* Schedule another call just to discuss this ticket specifically.(Mohammed)

 
h4. {*}Key Topics{*}{*}from 6/17{*}{*}:{*}
 * *Warning Message for Asset Swap:* Mohammed and Rohit discussed the need for a warning message when an asset is swapped in a fully published product. This warning is to ensure that the swapped asset is not released without proper QC, as it is currently happening without any warning.

 * *Consistency in Warning Messages:* Rohit emphasized the importance of keeping the warning messages consistent across both sides of the system. He suggested inviting Rithwik to the call to ensure consistency in the implementation of the warning messages.

 * *Background on the Ticket:* Mohammed provided background information on the ticket, explaining that the issue arises when an asset is registered and the product is fully published. The swapped asset gets released without going through QC or any warning message, which is not ideal.

 * *Discussion with Rithwik:* Rohit and Rithwik discussed the decision to check both the full publish status and the release date for the warning message. They also talked about the importance of keeping the conditions consistent across different sides of the system.

 * *Concerns about Full Publish Status:* Rohit raised concerns about the importance of the full publish status for the EOM team. He questioned whether the system should check for both the release date and the full publish status, as there might be situations where a product is released but not fully published.

 * *QC Notes and Linking:* Rohit and Rithwik discussed the importance of QC notes in the linking process. They considered whether the system should check if QC notes are locked before allowing the linking of a new asset to a fully published product.

 * *Immersive Assets and QC Notes:* Rohit and Rithwik discussed the specific requirements for immersive assets, including the need for QC notes to be locked before linking. They considered whether the system should have additional validations for immersive assets compared to other asset types.

 * *Discussion with Mike:* Rohit and Mike discussed the importance of QC notes and the potential issues that could arise if QC notes are not locked before linking an asset to a fully published product. They considered whether to implement a hard block or a warning message for this situation.

 * *Decision on QC Notes:* Mike suggested that it is low risk to leave the system as is, without implementing a hard block for QC notes. He emphasized that the current system should be sufficient and that any issues could be addressed through tickets if they arise.

 * *Immersive Assets and Release Dates:* Rohit and Mike discussed the need to handle warnings differently for immersive assets, considering their specific release dates. They agreed to discuss this internally and potentially break it down into different projects.

 * *Next Steps:* Mohammed and Rohit agreed to discuss the considerations for QC lock and immersive release dates internally. They planned to break down the project into different phases and address any issues that arise in the second phase.

column1: [UI]UST - Stereo - Wav 16b & 24b - PreFlight - Format
column28:
*User Story 1*
As a user registering a wav 16b or 24b assets,
I want the system to validate the asset format during preflight check before submission,
So that I can avoid submitting an asset that does not meet the required format.


*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the user selects a wav 16b or 24b asset,
*WHEN* the preflight check is initiated,
*THEN* the system should validate the format of the asset.

*User Story 2*
As a user,
I want to see a disabled “Submit” button when my asset format is incorrect,
So that I understand that I cannot proceed with the registration.


*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a WAV asset that is neither PCM nor RF64,
*WHEN* the preflight check is completed,
*THEN* the “Submit” button should be greyed out and disabled.

*User Story 3*
As a user,
I want to receive an error message when my asset format is invalid,
So that I am informed about what needs to be fixed before submission.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* that the asset format is incorrect,
*WHEN* the preflight check fails,
*THEN* a red exclamatory icon should be displayed in the preflight message section with the message: “The format of the submitted file %s is not PCM or RF64. The submitted asset must be PCM or RF64 audio.”

*User Story 4*
As a user,
I want to see a suggested corrective action when my asset’s format is invalid,
So that I know how to properly format my asset for successful registration.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* that the asset format is incorrect,
*WHEN* the preflight check fails,
*THEN* the user should see the suggested corrective action: "Please review the asset, confirm it is PCM or RF64 and resubmit for registration. Compliance guidelines can be found here: https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/."

column1: [UI]UST - Immersive, Stereo Audio - Having an indicator for explicit content
column28:
*User Story 1: Viewing Explicit Badge*

As a user, I want to see an "Explicit" badge next to tracks that are labeled explicit, so that I can easily identify which tracks contain explicit content.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I am on the UST Immersive or Stereo Audio product page
*WHEN* I view a track that is labeled as explicit
*THEN* I should see an "E" badge displayed next to that track.

*User Story 2: No Badge Display for Neutral Tracks*

As a user, I want to see no badges next to tracks that are not labeled explicit ensuring I have a clear interface.
*Acceptance Criteria:*
GIVEN I am on the UST Immersive or Stereo Audio product page
WHEN I view a track that is labeled neither explicit nor IG
THEN I should see no badges displayed next to that track.

*User Story 3: Badge Display Colour*

As a user, I want to see a badge 'E' with red background same as what we have on the stereo audio  next to tracks if its explicit.
*Acceptance Criteria:*
GIVEN I am on the UST Immersive or Stereo Audio product page
WHEN I view a track that is labeled as explicit 
THEN I should see a badge 'E' with red background same as what we have on the stereo audio next to tracks

column1: Race Condition with downConvert
column28:
*Pre-Reqs:*
 * Empty product - no linked masters

*Desc:*
 # User registers a full master/full side wav 24 asset with down-convert option enabled
 # When the wav24 upload finishes up we create the wav16 master and assetUplods
 ## Here there can be a rare condition if two wav 24 uploads finish at the exact same time
 ## For example filePackage needs a unique key so if both downconverts trigger at the same time it will fail

We should see if we can better handle this potential race condition. 

*AC:*
 * Down convert for these cases should proceed as normal (no weird exception).
 ** Ideally for testing we want files of similar sizes to try to have them finish processing close together but realistically just testing general cases should be fine

*Testing Cases:*

Full Master down convert from Wav 24
 # No linked wav 24 master or linked wav 16 master
 # Linked wav 16 master but no linked wav 24 master
 # Linked wav 16 master and linked wav 24 master 

*Sanity Test:*
 # A sanity test of wav 16 full master down convert should be performed
 # A sanity test of single file wav 24/wav 16 downconvert should be performed

*Notes:*
 * Master Hierarchy can also cause race condition

column1: Bug Fix: Un-registration issue when clearing last asset and uploading
column28:
*Desc:*

There is an issue if a user clears the last asset tied master and then proceeds to register a new asset before the other asset finishes unregistering. The new upload will still use the old job that we are updating to purge and clearing out the file packages for which leads to a data issue. We should better handle this scenario

*Dev Notes:*
 * Check with DB team if updating a purged back to registered will cause issues before going down any route of re-using purged job

column1: Add permission validation on the URL for Media Batch Converter
column28:
Currently when use accesses the URL ([https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/aoma-ui/media-batch-converter]) without having permission (Media Batch Convert) to the page is redirecting to the landing page instead of showing the user that there is no permission to access the page. 
Need to show the error message on the page when there is no permission.

message - You do not have the necessary permission to view this page.



+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
*1. Given* the user has the Media_Batch_Convert permission,
*When* they access the Media Batch Converter page via URL,
*Then* the page should load correctly.


*2. Given* the user does not have the Media_Batch_Convert permission,
*When* they attempt to access the Media Batch Converter page *via URL,*
*Then* the page should not be displayed,
    *And* an error message should be shown stating: “You do not have the necessary permission to view this page.”


*3. Given* the user does not have the Media_Batch_Convert permission,
*When* they attempt to navigate to the Media Batch Converter page *from the Artist Search page,*
*Then* the Media Batch Converter page should not be displayed,
    *And* an error message should be shown stating: “You do not have the necessary permission to view this page.”

column1: Implement "Asset Upload Job Status" Page
column28:
'+*Description:*+

We need to implement a new page called {*}“Asset Upload Job Status”{*}, similar in layout to the existing {*}Registration Job Status page{*}. While the Registration Job Status page currently shows upload status at the product level only, there are cases where a product contains multiple tracks, and each track may have a different upload outcome (some succeed, others fail). This new interface will allow users to monitor the upload status at the track level.

The following features should be implemented:

1. A new column called “Asset Upload ID” should be added 

2. Two ways to access the new page:
       I.  Via the *Asset Administration menu* (if the user has the appropriate permission).
       II.  By clicking on the *Job ID hyperlink* in the Registration Job Status page. The current Job ID field should be converted from plain text into a clickable link. When accessed this way, the *Job ID filter* in the new page should be pre-filled accordingly.

3. In the new page, the *Date filter* should default to showing data from the *past two days* only. Users must manually adjust the filter to see older records.

4. *Master #* column should be clickable, but the info icon should be removed in the first phase

5. Remove the *Security Group* column from this view.

6. Access control:
        I. Users with *REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW_ALL* permission can view all upload jobs, and filter by username.
        II. Users with *REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW* permission can only view their own jobs, and the username filter should be pre-filled with their username and greyed out.

7. Only users with *REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW_ALL* or *REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW* permissions can see the Asset Upload Job Status option in the {*}Asset Administration menu{*}.

8. *Sorting* on the page should ensure the *most recent Asset Upload ID appears first* (at the top)

+*MockUps:*+

Asset Upload Status page

!Asset Upload Status -- After Refinement 3.0.png|width=799,height=367!

Asset Administration Menu (Follow alphabetical order)

!Asset Upload Job Status -- menu option.png|width=468,height=682!

+*User Story:*+

*As a* system user,
*I want* to view detailed track-level upload statuses in the Asset Upload Job Status page,
*So that* I can verify the status of each uploaded track, especially when products contain multiple assets with different outcomes.

{color:#ff0000}Currently, the {*}Type{*}, {*}Status{*}, and *Asset Upload #* filters are not functional. All other filters are working as expected. These three filters will be made active in the August build.{color}

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
1. *Given* the user has REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW_ALL or REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW permission,
*When* they open the main menu,
*Then* they should see the “Asset Upload Job Status” option.

2. *Given* the user does *NOT* have REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW_ALL or REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW permission,
*When* they open the main menu,
*Then* they should *NOT* see the “Asset Upload Job Status” option.

3. *Given* the user is on the Registration Job Status page,
*When* they click on a Job ID,
*Then* they should be redirected to the Asset Upload Job Status page with the {*}Job ID filter pre-filled{*}.

4. *Given* the user opens the Asset Upload Job Status page directly from menu option,
*When* the page loads,
*Then* the Date filter should default to the last two days’ records.

5. *Given* the user has REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW_ALL permission,
*When* they use the username filter,
*Then* they can enter any username as a filter to view corresponding upload statuses.

*6. Given* a user has the REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW_ALL permission,
*When* they click the Job ID hyperlink on the Registration Job Status page,
*Then* they should be redirected to the Asset Upload Job Status page,
       *And* the page should display all upload jobs associated with that Job ID.

7. *Given* the user has only REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW permission,
*When* they access the Asset Upload Job Status page,
*Then* the page should be pre-filtered with their own username and only shows relevant jobs.

*8. Given* a user has the REGISTRATION_STATUS_VIEW permission,
*When* they click the Job ID hyperlink on the Registration Job Status page,
*Then* they should be redirected to the Asset Upload Job Status page,
        *And* the page should only display upload jobs associated with that user for that Job ID.

*9. Given* an asset contains a Master #,
*When* the Asset Upload Job Status page is displayed,
*Then* the Master # column should be clickable and direct users to master details page, but no info icon should be displayed for now.

*10. Given* upload records are loaded on the page,
*When* they are sorted,
*Then* the most recent Asset Upload ID should appear at the top of the list.

11. *Given* the user is viewing the Asset Upload Job Status page,
*When* columns are displayed,
*Then* each column should display as order below:

Asset Upload #

Type

Master # (Asset level)

Original File Name

Status/Description

Master #

Product #

UST

Job #

Username

Start Date

End Date

column1: UI: Preflight handle out of memory issue gracefully - Analysis
column28:
*Desc:*

Sometimes when pre-flight is handle a file that is too large it errors out with an out of memory issue. If we know the size limits and its possible to determine the size before pre-flight we should skip pre-flight and give a warning that we could not run pre-flight.

column1: Ensure Preflight Registration Validation Messages in cover Match Defined Worksheet
[BE]UST - DVD DDP - TusD Implementiation
Support Mobile Product Export in MBC Interface
column28:
'+*Description:*+

To support export of mobile products via MBC, several UI changes are required in the interface. A new radio button "Mobile Lookup" will be introduced as a search option. When this option is selected:
• The search box text will change to "Enter Product Number", as only mobile product numbers will be supported (ISRCs or other product Lookup will not return any results).
• On the right side of the UI, under *Audio Options,* only one option, *"Mobile Clip"* will be displayed. 
• If the mobile product includes *cover* content, the *Cover Option* will also be displayed.
    Upon selecting Select Destination, under Audio Format, the available CTs will be:

!image-2025-07-25-10-56-31-615.png|width=456,height=235!

!image-2025-07-25-10-57-20-676.png|width=419,height=233!

 

    Under Graphics Format, the available options will remain:

      Source Master - CT 4202
       VSC Image Conversion for VEVO scaled to HD Matted - CT 3005
 

!image - 2025-07-24T214722.368.png|width=501,height=234!

+*User Story:*+

*As a* user of the MBC interface,
*I want* to be able to export mobile products with a better UI and format options,
*So that* I can efficiently export mobile clips and associated cover assets
 
 
+*Acceptance Criteria:*+ #

*1. Given* the user is on the MBC interface,
*When* the "Mobile Lookup" radio button is selected,
*Then* the search field should display the text "Enter Product Number" and accept only mobile product numbers.
*2. Given* the "Mobile Lookup" option is selected,
*When* the user enters a non-mobile product number or an ISRC,
*Then* no search results should be returned for that
*3. Given* the user performs a mobile lookup using a valid mobile product number,
*Then* under Audio Options, only the "Mobile Clip" option should be shown,
*And* it should be unselected by default and clickable 
*4. Given* the mobile product contains cover content,
*When* the product is successfully looked up,
*Then* a Cover Option should also appear on the right side under graphics option.

*5.Given* the user has just looked up mobile products
*When* neither the “Cover” checkbox nor the “Mobile Clip” checkbox is selected
*Then* the “Submit” button should be grayed out and not clickable

*6. Given* the user has just looked up mobile products
*When* the user selects either the “Cover” checkbox or the “Mobile Clip” checkbox

    *And* user has selected one or more mobile products to export

    *And* the user has completed all mandatory fields in Select Destination section with valid input
*Then* the “Submit” button should become active and clickable
 

7. *Given* the user has just looked up mobile products
*When* the user selects both the “Cover” checkbox and the “Mobile Clip” checkbox

    *And* user has selected one or more mobile products to export

    *And* the user has completed all mandatory fields in Select Destination section with valid input

*Then* the “Submit” button should remain active and clickable
 

*8. Given* the user clicks "Select Destination" after a valid lookup,
*Then* under Audio Format, only the following options should be displayed:

!image-2025-07-25-10-56-45-808.png|width=376,height=194!

!image-2025-07-25-10-57-30-957.png|width=349,height=194!

*9. Given* the user clicks "Select Destination",
*Then* under Graphics Format, the following options should be shown:

             *Source Master - CT 4202*
             *VSC Image Conversion for VEVO scaled to HD Matted - CT 3005*

column1: UST - Import Security Group - SME US & Imprint Labels
column28:
*Desc:*
Currently there are no mapping for SME US parent rep owner & maintenance owner we need to be adding a mapping for SME US.

If the parent rep owner & maintenance owner are both SME US then the system should look up for the imprint label. If the imprint label is of any of the below then the respective security group should be populated.

If the parent rep owner & maintenance owner are both SME US and if the imprint label is null (If no imprint label is available) then by default we need to populate "The Orchard" security group.

*SME US Imprint Label List:*
 * (dis)harmony
 * Monument Records
 * Palm Tree Records
 * Three Six Zero Recordings
 * Zelig Records

*Testing Pre-Reqs:*
 * User A should not have access to imported SG's (main use case)
 * User B can have access to SG's (sanity)

{*}Testing Cases:{*}{*}{*}
 # Product A has SME US parent rep owner & maintenance owner and imprint label name in our list (Ex: *Zelig Records)* 
 ## Clicking import SG's on pre-release product should add the mapped sg to the list (Ex: {*}Zelig{*})
 ## After add one more SG the user execute access on has access to they should be able to register with imported SG 
 # Product B has SME US parent rep owner & maintenance owner and imprint label not in the above list
 ## Clicking import SG's on pre-release product should add *Orchard* sg to the list
 ## After add one more SG the user actually has access to they should be able to register with imported SG

column1: [BE]UST - All Master Type - Change Modified By, Modified Date, Registration Date & Registered By To Last Updated & Last Updated By
column28:
*User Story 1:* Display Last Updated By Information
As a user, I want to see the “Last Updated By” field showing the username of the person who registered an asset when I view a product, so that I can identify who is responsible for the latest changes.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I have opened a product,
*WHEN* I view the product details,
*THEN* I should see the “Last Updated By” field populated with the username of the user who registered the asset.

 

*User Story 2:* Display Last Updated Timestamp
As a user, I want to see the “Last Updated” field showing the date and time of the last update made to the asset, so that I can understand the recency of the modifications made.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I have opened a product,
*WHEN* I view the product details,
*THEN* I should see the “Last Updated” field populated with the date and time of when the last update occurred.

 

*User Story 3:* Remove Registration and Modification Fields
As a user, I want the “Registered By,” “Registration Date,” “Modified By,” and “Modified Date” fields to be removed from the UST header section, so that I am not confused by outdated or irrelevant information.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I have opened a product,
*WHEN* I view the product details,
*THEN* I should NOT see the “Registered By,” “Registration Date,” “Modified By,” or “Modified Date” fields displayed.

 

*Notes From Refinement 6/12/2025:*

Currently Last Updated By shows user id should we update it to email ?

When all this field should be updated ? Registration, Asset Swap(mentioned in the AMSE that this should be included), Delete ?

For the last updated field should we have the same date format ?

column1: Add Extra Validation for A3 calls/New A3 endpoint for VSC
column28:
*Desc:*

If a uploads a brand new VSC via A3, and then attempts to do so again after registration without loading, the request is missing expected information (trackMasterId) which causes issues in the registration (it will attempt to create a new trackMaster).

We could add validations to prevent this but I think a better long term is to create a specific registration endpoint for A3 to use for their VSC workflows. In that approach we can ask them for less information and do the looks on our end.

 

*Update:*

For scope of this ticket we are just handling extract. File upload will be handled at a later time.

 

*Dev Notes:*

New endpoint example:

 
{code:java}
mutation {    
submitVscExtractionJob(registrationInputRequestDto:{	       
catalogKey:"G0100032333163",        
masterUploadInfo:{            
parentMasterTypeId:101,            
#parentMasterId:123123            
securityGroup:[{                    
   securityGroupId: 815,                     
   securityGroupName: "AOMA Internal"                
},                
{                    
   securityGroupId: 1,                     
   securityGroupName: "Sony Music - Restricted"                
}]        
},        
jobRequestInfo:{            
   priority:100,            
   masterOnly:false,            
   assetSwapEnabled:false,            
   masterSwap:false,            
   #masterSwapReason:"Testing"        
},        
graphicUploadInfo:{            
   vscExtractionSourceVideoParentMasterId:5703730,            
   vscTiming:"4000",            
   selectedVscTimeOption: "milliseconds"        
}    
}){        
   masterId        
   assetRegistrationJobId        
   assetUploadId    
}} {code}

column1: [BE]UST - AMB - Having a view option for the descriptor when the user clicks the descriptor icon
Hotfix for Asset Upload Job Status page
column28:
'+*Description:*+
On the Asset Upload Job Status Page, when users click a clickable {*}Job ID from the Registration Job Status Page{*}, the system should automatically apply a filter using the corresponding Job ID. This Job ID filter must be correctly populated, and the Asset Upload job status page should only display assets related to that specific Job ID.

Additionally, pagination on the Asset Upload Job Status Page must function correctly.

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
*1. Given* the user clicks a Job ID from the Registration Job Status Page,
*When* they are redirected to the Asset Upload Job Status Page,
*Then* the Job ID filter should be automatically and correctly populated with the clicked Job ID.
*2. Given* the Job ID filter is applied,
*When* the Asset Upload Job Status page loads,
*Then* only assets related to that specific Job ID should be displayed.
*3. Given* the asset list is paginated,
*When* the user navigates through pages,
*Then* pagination should work as expected

 

{color:#4c9aff}*Please note that the asset upload data is available only for UST registrations and not available for legacy. Meaning the DDP DVD registration job ID that did not open properly was registered via Legacy UI and not UST and that is why it did not yield the results.*{color}

column1: Improve Product Lookup performance for bulk product numbers in MBC
column28:
'+*Description:*+

Currently, when users enter a large number of product numbers—sometimes in the hundreds or thousands—into the search box of the Media Batch Converter feature and click the Lookup button, the system takes an extended time to load the results. We would like to optimize and improve the lookup performance for such cases.

(We plan to skip all validations when we look up products, just a simple lookup query based on product number. we only implement validation when submitting for export.)

+*User Story:*+
*As a* user of the Media Batch Converter,
*I want* the system to quickly process and return results even when I input a large number of product IDs,
{*}So tha{*}t I can complete high-volume export tasks more efficiently without long wait times.

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
*1. Given* the user enters a large number of product IDs (e.g. 500+),
*When* they click the Lookup button,
*Then* the system should return results within an optimized and reasonable timeframe.
*2. Given* a performance enhancement is implemented,
*When* compared to the current average lookup time for high-volume input,
*Then* the improved lookup process should show measurable time reduction.

column1: [UI] Improve Product Lookup performance for bulk product numbers in MBC
column28:
*1. Behavior Based on Product Lookup Type (Product / Product+ISRC)*

*Description:*
Update lookup behavior to distinguish between pure product number input and product + ISRC input. A pure product number lookup returns only the product entry level details. The associated tracks will only be fetched when the user expands the product. If both product number and ISRC are entered, only the product level details will be returned, and only matching ISRC track should be fetched and shown after user click expand button.

{color:#ff0000}*Acceptance Criteria:*{color}
    *Given* the user enters a product number only
*When* the Product lookup is performed
*Then* only the product is displayed, and track-level data is fetched only upon expansion
    *Given* the user enters a combination of product number and ISRC
*When* the Product lookup is performed
*Then* only the product is displayed, and the specified ISRC track are fetched and displayed upon expansion

*2. Conditional Display of Audio/Video/Graphics Export Options*

*Description:*
The checkboxes for audio, video, and graphic export options should dynamically display based on the master types present in the searched products.

{color:#ff0000}*Acceptance Criteria:*{color}
    *Given* the user looks up products that include audio master types
*When* the export options panel loads
*Then* the Audio export option checkbox should be displayed
    *Given* the user looks up products that include video master types
*When* the export options panel loads
*Then* the Video export option checkbox should be displayed

(Cover Option)
*Given* the user searches for products in MBC,
        *And* at least one of the searched products contains registered cover masters,
*Then* the Cover checkbox shall be displayed under the Graphics Options section,
*And* the user shall be able to select or unselect the Cover checkbox.

(VSC Option)
*Given* the user searches for products in MBC,
        *And* at least one of the searched products contain a video asset,
*Then* the VSC checkbox shall be displayed under the Graphics Options section,
*And* the user shall be able to select or unselect the VSC checkbox.

*Given* the user searches for products in MBC,
        *And* none of the searched products contain registered cover master,
        *And* none of the searched products contain video assets,
*Then* the Graphics Options section shall not be displayed.

 

*3. De-duplication of Lookup Results and Info Icon Explanation*

*Description:*
If users input duplicate product numbers or product+ISRC combinations, only unique entries should be shown in the results. Any duplicates should be captured in the Info Icon section with a new column labeled “Product/ISRC Number” and a note explaining that duplicates are hidden.

{color:#ff0000}*Acceptance Criteria:*{color}
(Duplicated Entry Found)
*Given* the user performs a product lookup in the system,
*When* the searched product number, or the combination of product number and ISRC, is duplicated in the user’s search input,
*Then* the duplicated entry shall not be displayed in the search results,
    *And* the Info Icon shall display a description indicating that the entry was excluded because it is duplicated.

(Non-Existent Product Lookup with Duplicate Searches)
*Given* the user performs a product lookup in the system,
*When* the searched product number, or the combination of product number and ISRC, does not exist in the system,
    *And* the user searches for this same non-existent product more than once,
*Then* no search result details shall be displayed for the non-existent product,
    *And* the Info Icon shall display a description stating that the product cannot be found in the system for the first occurrence,
    *And* for subsequent duplicate entries of the same non-existent product, the Info Icon shall display a description indicating that these entries were excluded because they are duplicated.

!image-2025-07-09-16-16-35-269.png!

*4. Product Lookup: Product /Product+ISRC not found*

*Given* the user performs a product lookup in the system,
*When* the user searches for a product number that does not exist in the system,
*Then* no entry details shall be displayed for that product number,
    *And* the Info Icon shall display a message indicate Product not found.

*Given* the user performs a product lookup in the system,
*When* the user searches for a *combination of product number and ISRC,*
    *And* the product number exists in the system but the ISRC does not exist for that product,
*Then* Product level details shall NOT be displayed for that product + ISRC combination,

    *And* no details shall be displayed for the ISRCs that do not exist,
    *And* the Info Icon shall display a message stating “ISRC not found.”

*Given* the user performs a product lookup in the system,
*When* the user searches for {*}a single product number with multiple ISRCs{*},
    *And* some or all of the searched ISRCs do not exist for that product,
*Then* the details shall be displayed for the product that exist,
    *And* no details shall be displayed for the ISRCs that do not exist,
    *And* the Info Icon shall display the following information in a single row:
• the product number in the first column,
• and, in the second column, a list of all ISRCs under that product number that were not found.

*5. Product vs. ISRC Lookup Count Display*

*Given* the user performs a product lookup in the system,
    *And* the user enters 10 product numbers / combinations of product number and ISRC,
    *And* only 3 unique, valid product numbers exist in the system among the searched entries,
*Then* for Product Lookup, the Info Icon section shall display the message:
“Showing X out of 10 products.”
where X represents the number of valid entries found.

*Given* the user performed the above product lookup,
    *And* the user transfers to the ISRC Lookup,
*Then* the message next to the Info Icon shall display:
“showing 3 products.”
    *And* the count 10 shall no longer be displayed, because the context has shifted to unique, valid products only.

*6. Select All Button State*

*Description:*
The “Select All” button should reflect the selection status of products/tracks: fully checked, partially checked, or unchecked.

{color:#ff0000}*Acceptance Criteria:*{color}
(Select All at Global Level)
*Given* the user views the hierarchical selection tree with the top-level Select All checkbox,
*When* the user selects the top-level Select All checkbox,
*Then* all products, all sides under each product, and all tracks under each side shall be selected.

(Deselecting a Lower-Level Item Updates Parent States)
*Given* the top-level Select All checkbox is selected,
    *And* all child items are initially selected,
*When* the user deselects a single track,
*Then* the following checkboxes shall change to a partially selected state:
• the Select All checkbox for the corresponding side,
• the Select All checkbox for the corresponding product,
• the top-level Select All checkbox.

(Scope of Select All)
*Given* a Select All checkbox exists at any level (global, product, or side),
*When* the user selects that checkbox,
*Then* it shall only select or deselect all immediate child items within its scope:
• The top-level Select All controls all products.
• A product-level Select All controls all sides under that product.
• A side-level Select All controls all tracks under that side.

*Given* a user has partially selected items under a side or product,
*When* not all child items are selected,
*Then* the parent checkbox shall display a partially selected state,
    *And* this partial state shall impact upward to the top-level checkbox if applicable.

*Given* the user has deselected all items under a side, product, or top-level,
*When* no child checkboxes remain selected,
*Then* the corresponding parent checkbox shall display as unchecked rather than partially selected.

 

*7.*  *Submit button remains enabled after closing the panel without applying, if data is valid and unchanged*

{color:#ff0000}*Acceptance Criteria*{color}
*Given* the user has previously opened the “Select Destination” panel,
    *And* all mandatory fields have been filled in with valid information and saved,
*When* the user reopens the “Select Destination” panel,
    *And* reviews the data without making any changes,
    *And* clicks the X to close the panel without clicking Apply,
*Then* the Submit button shall remain enabled,
    *And* the user shall be able to proceed by clicking the Submit button.

*8. Product Lookup performance improvement*

*{color:#ff0000}Acceptance Criteria{color}*

*Given* the user performs a product lookup using either a set of Product Numbers, or a set of Product Number + ISRC combinations,
*And* the number of items being looked up is the same as in previous system versions,
*When* the lookup is executed,
*Then* the system shall complete the lookup noticeably faster than in previous versions

 

 

{color:#FF0000}Please note:{color}
 # {color:#FF0000}If users click *Select Files* and choose the source.{color}
{color:#FF0000}• If the user {*}selects From Local{*}, the Dimensions field may be pre-populated automatically or it might require user to manually select the dimensions.{color}
{color:#FF0000}• If the user {*}selects From Sony CI{*}, the Dimensions field is always required to be manually selected, it is never pre-populated.{color}
 # {color:#FF0000}When users *Select Files From Local* and proceed to export, *a progress bar is displayed* after submission. If users Select Files From Sony CI, no progress bar for export is shown after submission.{color}
 # {color:#FF0000}If a user *Select Files* and opens the *Select Destination* pop-up, the submit button becomes greyed out and unclickable – even if all fields inside had been filled in. This behavior is incorrect and will be fixed in future release.{color}

column1: [BE]UST - AMB - Secondary Validations - Duration
column28:
*User Story 1:* Update Duration Validation
As a system owner, I want to update the duration validation limits for Album Motion assets from 10-35 seconds(Old Validation) to 8-20 seconds(New Validation) so that only assets within the necessary duration range are accepted.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* a new asset is uploaded,
*WHEN* the asset duration is less than 8 seconds or greater than 20 seconds,
*THEN* the system fails the asset.

 

*User Story 2:* Notify User on Validation Failure
As a user, I want to receive an email notification when my uploaded Album Motion asset fails validation due to incorrect duration so that I am informed of the issue promptly.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* an asset is failed because of duration,
*WHEN* the email notification is sent,
*THEN* the email includes the message: “The duration for the submitted Album Motion asset must be from 8 seconds to 20 seconds, the asset submitted duration ss:ff (seconds:frames) does not meet these requirements.” where ss:ff is replaced by the actual duration of the asset.

column1: Refactor Export Flow in MBC to Trigger Per-Product Post-Validation
column28:
*Acceptance Criteria:*
 * Per-Product Export Triggering:

The export should be triggered immediately after a product's validation completes, instead of waiting for all products to be validated.
 * Export Blocking Conditions:

Export must only proceed for products that pass all the required validations (e.g. product availability, media presence, valid attributes).

If validation fails, no export request should be made for that product, and the failure reason must be logged.
 * Concurrency Handling:

Export operations must be safely executed in a parallel or async-safe manner, ensuring no race conditions or shared state corruption occurs.
 * Export Results Tracking:

The result of each product's export (including export ID or failure reason) should be captured and recorded in the overall batch export response.
 * Batch Status Management:

The batch status should be updated to IN_PROGRESS only if at least one product has been successfully exported.

If all products fail validation, the batch should be marked as FAILED.
 * Logging and Error Handling:

Each product's export process must log success or failure independently.
Any unexpected errors should not block the export of other products.

column1: UST - All Master Type - PreFlight Window - Redesign
column28:
*User Story 1:* Display Preflight Header
As a user,
I want the preflight screen to display the action being performed and the master type,
So that I can quickly understand what action I am taking.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I have selected an asset for upload,
*WHEN* the preflight screen opens,
*THEN* the heading should show “Asset Swap - AMB 1x1 Asset”(It should display the action such as either "Registration" or "Asset Swap" along with the master type like shown in the below screenshot,last one) .

*User Story 2:* Cancel Button Functionality
As a user,
I want a “Cancel” button in the preflight screen,
So that I can close the popup window without making any changes.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I am on the preflight screen,
*WHEN* I click on the “Cancel” button,
*THEN* the preflight popup window should close.

*User Story 3:* Submit Button Functionality
As a user,
I want a “Submit” button in the preflight screen that behaves as it currently does,
So that my submission process remains unchanged.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I am on the preflight screen,
*WHEN* I click on the “Submit” button,
*THEN* it should perform the same submission operation as the existing workflow.

*User Story 4:* File Upload Section Display
As a user,
I want to see the name of the file or folder in the file upload section,
So that I can verify that I am uploading the correct asset.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I am on the preflight screen,
*WHEN* I select a file for upload,
*THEN* the file name should be displayed in the file upload section(NO FILE PATH SHOULD BE DISPLAYED).

*User Story 5:* Edit File Functionality
As a user,
I want to click on a pencil icon next to the file name,
So that I can open the local file browser to select a new file.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* the file upload section is displayed,
*WHEN* I click on the pencil icon,
*THEN* the local file browser window should open allowing me to select a new file.

*NOTE FOR USER USER STORY 5:* The icon looked a bit weird post our initial implementation so we decided to revise the icon, Still waiting for confirmation form GMP on the icon.  

*User Story 6:* Preflight Check Window Availability
As a user,
I want a preflight check window to be available near the file upload section,
So that I can ensure my file meets the necessary criteria before submission.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I am on the preflight screen,
*WHEN* the file upload section is loaded,
*THEN* the preflight check window should be displayed adjacent to the file name and edit icon.

 

!image-2025-05-07-17-44-57-920.png!

!image-2025-06-12-10-28-01-820.png!

!image-2025-06-12-10-33-37-375.png!

 

!image-2025-06-16-14-29-51-858.png!

+*Updates to QA:*+

*Things which were updated post our implementation.*

*!image-2025-07-14-10-46-50-740.png!*

*Having a grey bar on the bottom with the buttons looked weird so on 7/2/2025 with an in person discussion with Rohit we decided to remove the grey bar and just have the buttons, The above screenshot indicates how the pop up window screen should look.*

column1: [UI] Implement "Asset Upload Job Status" Page
DB Task: Add new Column to asset_registration_jobs
column28:
Hi db team,

After a discussion with the A3 team and kafka team we have decided to change our approach for this project. Rather than use a new job_status they would prefer us to use a flag to denote partial registrations. This will help prevent code changes from kafka and A3 linking side.

With that in mind can we add a new column in the asset_registration_jobs called 'partially_registered_fl'. We will be treating null as false so no need for a backfill.

Also we no longer need the new job_status we added 'Partially Registered' so this can be removed. This only ever used in dev since we didn't release this feature yet so there shouldn't be any stage/prod records of using it.

Let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Thanks
Matthew
column435:
27/Jun/25 8:12 PM;poth003;Hi [~spag001], A new column 'is_partially_registered_fl' has been created on asset_registration_jobs table on Dev. This is a Boolean column with existing records as null and the default has been set to false for all the new records. Also, registration status 'Partially Registered' has been removed.

There were 2 records in Dev on asset registration jobs table that had registration status as 'Partially Registered'. I updated these to 'Successfully Registered' and set the 'is_partially_registered_fl' to true. Please let me know if this is fine.

Please verify and let me know if you have any questions/concerns.

Thanks,

Phani;;;
column436: 30/Jun/25 11:28 PM;spag001;Looks good thanks Phani!;;;

column1: [BE] Get product sides and tracks by ISRCs or return all if ISRC list is empty
column28:
Create a new endpoint to retrieve product sides and their tracks based on the list of ISRCs provided.

* If the ISRC list is not empty, return only the sides and tracks that match the provided ISRCs.

* If the ISRC list is empty, return all sides and tracks of the specified product.

column1: Restrict Aspect Ratio Modification Options for Video Uploads in MBC
column28:
'+*Description:*+

When a user uploads a video file via the Select Files option in the Media Batch Converter, and the video has dimensions of 1920x1080, the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown currently shows four options. However, only Square Pixel is supported by the system for this specific dimension.

If the user mistakenly selects one of the other three unsupported options, the export will fail. This creates unnecessary failed jobs for users.

To prevent this:
• When the system detects a video file with 1920x1080 dimensions,
• The Aspect Ratio Modification field should display only one option: Square Pixel (the only supported setting),
• All unsupported options should be hidden from the dropdown in this case.

*And we need to consider all use cases with different dimensions.*

!Dimension first.png|width=567,height=246!

 

+*User Story:*+

*As a* user uploading a 1920x1080 video file via MBC,
*I want* to see only the valid Aspect Ratio option in the dropdown,
*So that* I don’t accidentally select an unsupported setting and cause the export to fail.

 

*Supported mapping between Dimensions and Aspect Ratio Modification:*

[^data-1751298634072.csv]

 

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+

*1. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 720x512,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Standard 4:3", "Full Screen 16:9", 
"Letterbox 4:3”.

*2. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 720x608,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Standard 4:3", "Letterbox 4:3", "Full Screen 16:9”.

*3. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 720x480,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Letterbox 4:3", "Standard 4:3", "Square Pixel", "Full Screen 16:9”.

*4. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 720x576,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Full Screen 16:9", "Letterbox 4:3", "Standard 4:3”.

*5. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 1280x720,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Square Pixel”.

*6. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 1920x1080,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Square Pixel”.

*7. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 720x486,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Standard 4:3", "Letterbox 4:3", "Full Screen 16:9”.

*8. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 2048x1152,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Square Pixel”.

*9. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 3840x2160,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Square Pixel”.

*10. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 4096x2160 ,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Square Pixel”.

*11. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 2560x1440,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Square Pixel”.

*12. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 4096x2304,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Square Pixel”.

*13. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 1080x1920,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Square Pixel”.

*14. Given* a user selects a video file via Select Files in MBC,
*When* the uploaded video has dimensions of 3840x2160,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should display only “Square Pixel”.

 

*15. Given* a user uploads a video file and the system does NOT pre-populate the Dimensions field,
*When* the user manually selects a dimension from the dropdown ,
*Then* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown should update dynamically to display {*}only the supported options for that selected dimension{*}.

*16. Given* a user is on the select file interface,
*When* the Dimensions and Aspect Ratio Modification fields are rendered,
*Then* the Dimensions field should be displayed before the Aspect Ratio Modification field.

*17. Given* a user selects a video file with any dimension,
*When* the Aspect Ratio Modification dropdown is shown,
*Then* it should display only the options supported for the specific dimension, and hide any unsupported ones.

*18. Given* the user uploads a video file,

    *And* the system has pre-populated the dimension values for that file,
*When* there is *only one supported* aspect ratio modification option for the uploaded video,
*Then* the system shall automatically populate that supported aspect ratio modification value in the UI without requiring user selection.
*19. Given* the user uploads a video file,

       *And* the system has pre-populated the dimension values for that file,
*When* there are *multiple supported* aspect ratio modification options for the uploaded video,
*Then* the system shall leave the aspect ratio modification field blank by default and display a dropdown list containing all supported options, so that the user can manually select the desired aspect ratio modification.

column1: Improve ISRC Lookup performance in MBC
column28:
'+*Description:*+

Currently, when users enter a large number of ISRC numbers—sometimes in the hundreds or thousands—into the search box of the Media Batch Converter feature and click the Lookup button, the system takes an extended time to load the results. We would like to optimize and improve the ISRC lookup performance.

 

!image-2025-05-28-14-58-52-034.png|width=633,height=305!

+*User Story:*+
*As a* user of the Media Batch Converter,
*I want* the system to quickly process and return results even when I input a large number of ISRCs,
{*}So tha{*}t I can complete high-volume export tasks more efficiently without long wait times.

{color:#ff0000}+*Acceptance Criteria:*+{color}
*1. Given* the user enters a large number of ISRCs (e.g. 500+),
*When* they click the Lookup button,
*Then* the system should return results within an optimized and reasonable timeframe.

*2. Given* a performance enhancement is implemented,
*When* compared to the current average lookup time for high-volume input,
*Then* the improved lookup process should show measurable time reduction.

*3. Given* the user performs a ISRC lookup 
*When* the Info Icon panel is opened
*Then* the first column title should be “ISRC Number”

!image-2025-07-09-17-00-45-477.png!

*4. Given* the user performs an ISRC lookup in the system,
*When* the entered ISRC does not exist in the system and is invalid,
*Then* no matching product/ISRC details shall be displayed for that ISRC,
    *And* the Info Icon shall display the message: “There is no matching product found for the ISRC.”

*5. Given* the user performs an ISRC lookup in the system,
*When* the same ISRC is entered multiple times in the lookup input,
*Then* the duplicate ISRC entries shall be displayed only once,
    *And* the Info Icon shall display the message indicate Duplicate ISRC ID.

  !image-2025-07-09-17-02-54-617.png|width=579,height=230!
column437:
16/Jul/25 7:26 PM;mbrice1;STAGE testing

{color:#ff0000}+*Acceptance Criteria:*+{color}
*1. Given* the user enters a large number of ISRCs (e.g. 500+),

column1: Fix upload failure for files larger than 5 GB via MBC "Select Files" option
column28:
'+*Description:*+
Currently, when using the "Select Files" option in MBC to upload large files from local, the upload fails if the file size exceeds 5GB. This issue needs to be fixed so that files larger than 5GB can be successfully uploaded using the "Select Files" functionality.

!image - 2025-07-23T101501.898.png|width=565,height=340!

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
*Given* a user is on the MBC interface and selects the "Select Files" option to upload from local,
*When* the user attempts to upload a file larger than 5GB,
*Then* the file should be successfully uploaded without failure.

column1: Envelope Button Logic
column28:
Envelope Button on UST screen should be enabled or disabled based on the status. 

 

*Envelope Button should be only enabled in below three statuses:*

1) When there is no registration (this is when no asset is there like fresh master)
2) When unregistered (this is when something was registered to the master but unregistered successfully) 
3) When Deleted ( this when sometimes registration fails and show failed status and the users delete the entry so status changes to deleted)

*Envelope Button should be only disabled for all the below statuses:*

Pending
AssetUploadInProgress
AssetCreationInProgress
AssetValidationInProgress
AssetRegistrationInProgress
Registered
Failed
Cancelled
SwapInProcess
AssetUnRegistrationInProgress
AssetUnregistrationFailed
ConversionError
Auto Correction In-Progress
ManualQcInProgress
Archive In Progress
ValidationError
Asset Upload Cancelled
DeleteFailed
SwapFailed
AssetUnRegistrationPending

This is the complete list where the button should be disabled. There is less chance that anything else got missed. Even though if anything else is missed we can depend on by following that Envelope is strictly enabled for only above mentioned three cases we should be good enough.

column1: Move SearchForProduct kafka messaging to event based for tracks
column28:
*Dev:*

A user registered a 90 track product in UST that had 5 securitys tied to the master. In the backend we then proceeded to send a lot of messages to the searchForProduct kafka topic and overloaded the system for a bit. Since its tied to the master we can instead send it later when all the registrations are done, like we are doing with the email notification, for multi track uploads.

column1: [UI]ANALYSIS - UST - SFV - Download for Source Master & Autocorrected using http download
[BE] Ensure Parent Folder Exists in Sony CI Before Starting Export
column28:
{*}Description{*}:
We’ve noticed that duplicate folders are sometimes created in Sony CI during export processing.

{*}Reason{*}:
Even after creating the parent folder, it doesn’t show up immediately in Sony CI’s search results. Because of this delay, the system or delivery team thinks the folder doesn’t exist and creates another one — causing duplicates.

{*}Proposed Fix{*}:
Before starting an export, we now check if the parent folder exists in Sony CI using their search API, based on the workspace ID and folder name.

If the folder isn’t found right away:
 *  We will wait and retry the search a few times.
 * Only start the export after confirming the folder exists.

column1: UST BE: Clear QC Notes Fields on Unregistration
column28:
*Desc:*

During un-registration UST default behavior is to clear out qc note information but we don't reset all information like:
 * attributes
 * quality level
 * source formatting

 

GMP is requesting that these fields should also be reset back to default.

*AC:*

When a user fully unregisters an asset (all tracks) the qcNote information should fully reset back to default values.
