column1: UST - Stereo Audio -  AQC -Registration -  Email Notification, WPTS, Manual & AQC
column28:
*Mohammed's Notes:*

NOTES:
-------
AQC Project Notes:
------------------
*Every stereo audio needs to go through AQC by default
*Every user needs to have the AQC role so everything getting registered goes through AQC
*Manual Full QC should be based on user permission only if the user has permission the user can request for the manual QC processes 
*If manual qc or AQC is in progress it should not go to the published status
*user preferences for QC should be part of the user management module and the onboarding process. They discussed the need to ask new users if their content requires full QC during onboarding.
*During the onboarding process, new users will be asked if their content requires full QC. This step ensures that QC preferences are captured early and incorporated into the workflow.
*need to capture the user ID for every efficacy check in the AQC process. They emphasized the importance of distinguishing between affiliate and GMP efficacy checks.
*Affiliate vs. GMP Checks: There was a discussion on distinguishing between affiliate and GMP efficacy checks. This distinction is important to ensure that checks are weighted appropriately based on the source.
*By capturing user IDs, the team can generate detailed reports and analyze the efficacy checks based on departments. This analysis helps in identifying trends and areas for improvement.
*discussed allowing users to opt for an AQC review before publishing their masters. This option provides flexibility and ensures that users can verify the quality of their content.
*A user-specific permission was considered to manage the flexibility in opting for AQC reviews. This system ensures that only authorized users can make such requests.
*discussed the process of creating JIRA tickets for QC requests and the possibility of using subtasks for multiple submissions. They considered the need to update open tickets with new submissions to avoid creating multiple tickets for the same product.
 
=============================================================================================================================================== 
WORKFLOW:
----------
USE CASE 1
User has Manual Full QC Permission:
Step 1(User has not checked the checkbox): 
Goes through the same regular AQC workflow as in Use case 2

Step 2(User has checked the checkbox) : 
User clicks on  select file and once they select the file on the preflight screen we need to have a checkbox 
to for Manual Full QC. 
If this checkbox is checked then the QC Notes 4 fields should become available for the user to fill in 
If the 
 
Step 2:
User clicks on the check box
The preflight window should have the text fields: Jira Number, QC Urgency, Request Complete Date & Comments
WPTS ticket gets created
 
Note for step 2: In this case if check box checked we need to update the QC notes header saying Manual QC pending
 
 
USE CASE 2
User does not have Manual Full QC permission (AQC)
No WPTS ticket created  
Goes only through AQC 
Once AQC is completed user should receive an email notification: 
1. Full Master Side - If all tracks are successful for AQC - Are we sending an email or are we sending emails only for failed ones, If its going to be sending emails are we adding it to the duration mismatch email or is it going to be a new email - CAN HAVE A SEPERATE EMAIL
2. Full Master Side - If few tracks fail are we adding it to the duration mismatch email or is it going to be a new email ?
3. Individual tracks  - Same as above  

======================================================================================================================================================== 
Follow-up tasks:
-----------------
User Management Module: Adjust the onboarding process to include questions about whether the content uploader requires full QC from GMP. (Muhammad)
QC Workflow: Confirm if the system is already checking at the header level for QC notes and ensure it prevents publishing without locking. (the team)
QC Notes Interface: Provide a button in the QC notes interface to send content to GMP for full QC if the user decides after AQC review. (the team)
Subtask Functionality: Explore the subtask functionality in JIRA to handle multiple track submissions under one main ticket. (the team)
JIRA Workflow: Refine the JIRA workflow based on different use cases encountered by GMP when it comes to QC. (the team)
Track Master Level QC: Discuss internally and propose a solution for handling asset swaps and ensuring QC notes are updated and locked at the track master level. (the team)
Temporary Audio Marking: Implement a badge and checkbox system to indicate temporary audio tracks in the UST interface. (the team)
Temporary Audio Validation: Determine if temporary audio tracks should skip validation and confirm with the GRPC group. (the team)
======================================================================================================================================================== 

Questions:
-----------
Should we always generate AQC or would we not in some workflows? (Matt.S) Answer - YES (Need to double check with Rohit)

===========================================================================================
Need to review this updated on 5/19 by Rithwik 
-------------------------------------------------

AQC and Manual QC are visualized together but separate in terms of supply chain policy. 

AQC - should have no effect on publish ability the notes merely exist, users can choose to review them. Users can also choose to edit AQC notes and update the efficacy of the notes, noting whether they are valid or invalid. 

Manual QC - has an immediate effect on Publish-Ability. If manual QC notes are created, the product cannot be published until the manual Qc notes are locked.  

AQC is an automated process which will/should occur on any registration of a supported master asset. Any time a supported master is registered AQC should be run, whether it be initial registration, or an asset swap. We must discuss the swap logic. 

Manual QC is a manual process wherein an engineer Performs a critical listen QC and validation of the automatically generated AQC notes. Manual QC notes exist therefore manual Qc notes lock must be completed to allow publish. Currently, a QC note has to exist at the track level in order to require Qc notes lock. This must be expended to if QC notes exist, even just header data and a QC comment. Notes ex

NOTES FROM ABOVE AS DISCUSSED WITH RITHWIK(***Mo's analysis)
If the AQC flags something then the QC should go through manual qc irrespective of whether the user has the manual qc permission - ***Question Should all users by default have QC NOTES VIEW permission ?  

If the AQC does not flag something then the QC should get auto locked and this can get auto published(Current workflow if no manual QC).

 

============================================================

*Notes from Rohit from 5/29/2025 call:*

Phase 1: AQC Notifications:

New Subscription: AQC Completion 

this subscription is used to send AQC notification for all new stereo registration that are going through AQC... (with AQC attachment)

+*NOTE: Mike wanted to have both manual & AQC as a combined attachment*+ *- This should only happen when the AQC is locked & the user requests for manual QC (Confirmed by Mike on 7/10/2025)*

Last Updated Date: May 29, 2025
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Master: 000005687130 - Audio Master WAV 24 Bit
Artist(s): Carly Simon
Master name: 5 Song Sampler
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Registered by: roraj01 (rohit.raj@sonymusis.com)
1: Moonlight Serenade
  ISRC: USSM10503055
  P-Line: (P) 2005 SONY BMG MUSIC ENTERTAINMENT
  Actual Duration (hh:mm:ss:ff): 00:04:31:25
  Entered Duration (hh:mm:ss:ff): 00:04:03:00
    AQC Note - Frequency drop off at 17.48kHz (Error: 0101) L/R Unexpected Bandwidth  (N/A - N/A)

 

it should be event based notifications so if 5 tracks get registered at once out of 10... (follow how the registration even based notification works on UST)

 

===========================================================

*Notes from Co pilot from 5/29/2025 call:*
Generated by AI. Be sure to check for accuracy.
Meeting notes: * *AQC Notifications:* Rohit and Mohammed discussed the need for AQC notifications to be added to JIRA phase one. They emphasized the importance of sending notifications when AQC is completed, especially for multiple tracks registered together.
 * 
 ** *Notification Process:* Rohit explained that Vicki proposed sending email notifications with attachments for AQC notes, which can then be forwarded to ANR for review. This process ensures that GMP or release plans can opt for detailed QC workflows if necessary.
 ** *JIRA Documentation:* Rohit emphasized the need to document the AQC notification process in JIRA, specifically in phase one. He instructed Mohammed to add the AQC notifications to JIRA to ensure proper tracking and implementation.
 ** *Multiple Tracks:* Rohit discussed scenarios where multiple tracks are registered together, highlighting the need to wait for all AQC processes to complete before sending a single notification for those tracks. This ensures that all relevant AQC information is included in the notification.
 * *Separate AQC Email:* Mohammed and Matthew agreed that AQC notifications should be sent as a separate email rather than included in the registration email. This ensures clarity and avoids mismatches in timing.
 ** *Separate Email:* Mohammed and Matthew discussed the importance of sending AQC notifications as separate emails to avoid timing mismatches. They agreed that including AQC information in the registration email could lead to confusion, so a separate email is more effective.
 ** *Implementation Plan:* Matthew confirmed that the plan is to create a new email specifically for AQC notifications. This approach ensures that the notifications are clear and distinct from registration emails, improving communication and reducing errors.
 * *AQC Notification Subscription:* Rohit proposed creating a new subscription for AQC notifications. This subscription would send notifications for all new registrations going through AQC, including attachments with AQC information.
 ** *New Subscription:* Rohit proposed the creation of a new subscription for AQC notifications. This subscription would ensure that all new registrations undergoing AQC receive notifications, including relevant attachments with AQC information.
 ** *Subscription Details:* Rohit detailed the subscription process, explaining that the notifications would include attachments with AQC information such as track names, ISRC, and AQC notes. This ensures comprehensive communication of AQC results.
 * *AQC Attachment Format:* Rohit outlined the format for AQC attachments, including details such as track name, ISRC, actual duration, and AQC notes. Mohammed and Rohit discussed the need to refine this format further.
 ** *Attachment Details:* Rohit outlined the necessary details for AQC attachments, including track name, ISRC, actual duration, and AQC notes. These details ensure that the AQC information is comprehensive and useful for recipients.
 ** *Format Refinement:* Rohit and Mohammed discussed the need to refine the AQC attachment format further. They agreed to review and adjust the format to ensure it meets all requirements and provides clear, detailed information.
 * *Handling Track Swaps:* Rohit explained the process for handling track swaps and the need to indicate changes in AQC notifications. This includes highlighting which AQC notes have been updated due to the swap.
 ** *Track Swap Process:* Rohit explained that when a track is swapped, the AQC notifications must indicate which AQC notes have been updated. This ensures that recipients are aware of any changes and can review the updated information accordingly.
 ** *Notification Updates:* Rohit emphasized the importance of highlighting updated AQC notes in the notifications. This includes indicating which notes have been revised due to the track swap, ensuring clear communication of changes.
 * *Efficacy in AQC Notifications:* Rohit emphasized the importance of including efficacy information in AQC notifications if available. This ensures that any changes or validations made by GMP are communicated effectively.
 ** *Including Efficacy:* Rohit stressed the need to include efficacy information in AQC notifications. This ensures that any validations or changes made by GMP are clearly communicated, providing recipients with complete and accurate information.
 ** *Validation Communication:* Rohit explained that including efficacy information in the notifications helps communicate any validations made by GMP. This ensures that recipients are aware of the status and quality of the tracks.
 * *Next Steps and Documentation:* Rohit, Mohammed, and Matthew agreed to document the discussed points in a JIRA ticket and schedule another meeting to focus on AQC email notifications. They also discussed the need for Copilot notes to be shared for reference.
 ** *JIRA Documentation:* Rohit, Mohammed, and Matthew agreed to document all discussed points in a JIRA ticket. This ensures that all action items and decisions are tracked and can be referenced later.
 ** *Next Meeting:* They agreed to schedule another meeting to focus specifically on AQC email notifications. This follow-up meeting will help finalize the details and ensure all aspects are covered.
 ** *Copilot Notes:* They discussed the importance of sharing Copilot notes for reference. These notes will help ensure that all team members have access to the same information and can follow the discussion accurately.

Follow-up tasks: * *JIRA Documentation:* Document the AQC notifications process and add it to JIRA Phase One. (Rohit)
 * *Email Notification:* Create a new subscription for AQC completion notifications and determine the attachment format. (Rohit)
 * *Email Notification:* Ensure that the AQC completion notification includes all relevant AQC information and is sent out after all AQC processes are complete. (Matthew)
 * *Email Notification:* Indicate changes in AQC notes when an asset is swapped and include all AQC information in the notification. (Rohit)
 * *Email Notification:* Include efficacy information in the AQC notification template if available. (Rohit)
 * *JIRA Ticket:* Enter all discussed information about AQC notifications and email processes into a JIRA ticket. (Mohammed)
 * *Follow-up Meeting:* Schedule a follow-up meeting next week to review the AQC email notification process. (Rohit)

column1: [BE]UST - Report for tracking the usage of TusD uploader
column28:
This ticket is to generate a report for the usage of TusD for the last 6 months, The report should indicate when it was uploaded which master type whether its an individual asset upload or full master.

 

*Dev Notes:*
 * To determine if an upload is TUS currently the following must be true
 ** Aspera_transfer_spec is null (in the future tus spec will be set and this can be used but currently its not being used)
 ** Source_repository_type_id = 1
 * To determine if the upload is full master or individual asset upload the following can be done:
 ** Check if assetUploadMappingId is null
 ** fullMasterRegistrationViaFolderUpload flag inside asset_upload_attributes
 ** Check to see if assetUpload has the AssetUploadSorting task type (20) tied to that assetUpload
